loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a 28-year-old woman, married to Yoksan, 34. They are blessed with three children: Anastasia, 3, an elementary school student, Juanita, 5, in early childhood education, and Junior, 1 year old. 

Johana has a farm that is located not so far from her residence. Currently, Johana cultivates tomatoes and basil. Actually, Johana also cultivates beans and corn, but they had already been harvested and sold to the market. 

A few months ago, there was a plant disease attacking the farm near her farm; this situation worried her about her farm. She wanted to buy the pesticide for her plants, but she does not have much money to do so. Therefore, she requests an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on three different pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: to buy three different pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Sandra Judit

texts.es:
Desde hace mucho tiempo, la señora Sandra ha ejercido el oficio de la agricultura con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y tener un sustento para su familia.
Esta actividad la viene aplicando de manera efectiva ya que por sus condiciones económicas nunca pudo aspirar a una educación superior que le permitirá tener un trabajo con mejores ingresos.
Hoy en día pide un apoyo monetario para realizar la compra de productos para la preparación de sus tierras y la compra de insumos como semillas y abonos.
Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar sus cultivos y cosechar unos productos de mejor calidad.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y con gran vocación de trabajo. Entre sus mayores sueños están el poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una excelente educación, educación a la cual ella no pudo tener acceso.
texts.en:
For much time now, Sandra has been farming in order to generate income and provide for her family. This is an effective activity for her because, due to her financial circumstances, she was never able to get a secondary education that would allow her to obtain a job with a better income. Today, she is asking for monetary support in order to buy products to help prepare her lands as well as to buy supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. 

This loan will give Sandra the opportunity to improve her crops and to sow better quality products. Sandra is an enterprising woman with a vocation for the work that she does. among her biggest dreams are to be able to help her children get ahead and to offer them an excellent education like she did not have access to.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming and raising livestock, as well as products to help prepare her land.

loans.name: Benjamin De Jesus

texts.es:
Levantarse día a día sin descanso es la labor que ejercen miles de agricultores, personas que no tienen impedimentos de edad, salud o inconvenientes para ejercer su profesión pues a pesar de cualquier síntoma o circunstancia a la que se enfrenten siempre se levanta cada día para labrar su tierra .
Benjamín es uno de tantos agricultores que todos los días se levanta con la ilusión de tener una madrugada productiva y que sus cosechas sean abundantes puesto que su familia depende en totalidad de él y como buen campesino sabe lo difícil que es esta vida y es por esto que tomo la decisión de trabajar lo más fuerte que pueda para ofrecerle a sus hijos otras alternativas para vivir.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar la tierra: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes son los productos que más necesita pues su único sueño es ver a sus hijos obteniendo un título universitario
texts.en:
Getting up day after day without rest is the work that thousands of farmers do, people who don't have impediments of age, health or inconveniences to carry out their profession since, regardless of whatever symptom or circumstance they encounter, they always get up every day to work the land.

Benjamin is one of these farmers who gets up every day with the dream of having a productive early morning and that his harvests will be abundant since his family completely depends on him.  As a good farmer, he knows how difficult this life is and, for this, he decided to work as hard as he can to offer his children other alternatives for their lives.

He asks for this loan to purchase the supplies necessary to prepare the land. Manure, seeds, and fertilizers are the products he needs the most since his only dream is to see his children get a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare the land, looking to his crops as a way to get his children ahead.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис живет вместе со своими детьми в отдаленном регионе.  Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Наргис работает более 5 лет в средней школе. Она преподавательница. Наргис воспитывает 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Наргис использует зарплату для покупки продуктов питания и одежды для своих детей. Та как она разведена, она единственная кормилица своих детей. Наргис планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Ее дом в плохом состоянии. Наргис запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargis lives with her children in a remote region. She has a college degree in education. For over five years she has been working as a secondary school teacher. Nargis is raising three underage children. She uses her salary to buy food and clothing for her children. Since she is divorced, she is the sole breadwinner. Nargis plans to renovate her house, which is in a poor condition. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000 TJS in order to buy construction materials such as cement, wood etc. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her house.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in the village of Barcravan in Syunik region. He lives here with his wife and two daughters. Vardan is from a peasant family and he has no higher education, but thanks to his father’s precious advice, he is a perfect and already-skilled farmer. Vardan now works at the Kadjaran combine, but farming, agriculture and everything connected with it is more important and common to him. On his farm, he has two cows, two calves, 20 chickens and a horse. His large plot of land he cultivates perfectly and it gives a good harvest of tomatoes, cucumbers, greens and beans. As he says, his orchard is too nice and too rich for any description. You must just taste the sweetest apples, apricots and pears from his garden, that’s all. 

Vardan hopes to get his first Kiva loan because he needs to buy diesel fuel and fertilizer, and organize grass mowing activities in order to make his orchard clean and cute.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Bekha Maya

texts.en:
Bekha Maya is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Bekha Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called “pasal”, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 44-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She knows the techniques of stitching very well and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family.  Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past ten years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Farzana is a responsible mother of four children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Wilber Manuel

texts.es:
Wilber un emprendedor hombre de 51 años de edad motivado y empujado por su familia la cual la constituye su esposa y 5 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad pero algunos depende aun de él y por quienes velara hasta que su salud se lo permita.
Como agricultor se ve afectado por los constantes cambios climáticos que en ocasiones dañan sus cultivos o incluso por la desvaloración de sus productos y sobretodo pro el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar la tierra como lo son los abonos, fertilizantes y las semillas y esta es la principal razón por la que solicita una ayuda crediticia y es que usara el dinero pedido para la compra de estos productos para preparar sus tierras para el cultivo buscando siempre que su familia este bien y nunca en la vida les llegue a faltar un bocado de comida.
texts.en: Wilber is an 51-year-old entrepreneurial, motivated man who works hard for his family which includes his wife and five children. All of his children are grown up but a few of them still depend on him. He will look after them as long as his health allows. As a farmer he sees the constant effects of climate change that occasionally hurt his crops and even devalue his products. Above all else, the price of supplies needed to work the land, such as fertilizers and seeds, are high. This is the main reason why he is applying for financial help . He will use the requested money to buy these products to prepare the land for planting with hopes that his family will always be well and never in life will they lack a bite of food.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare the land since high prices have exceeded his profits.

loans.name: Porfirio Alindor

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad de clima variado, su población es amable, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, transportando a sus pasajeros por la ruta de Cayalti – Zaña - Mocupe y viceversa desde hace 01 año aproximadamente, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de aceites y arreglos de para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 52 years old and lives in Lagunas district, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. It is a community with a varied climate. The people who live there are friendly and engage in agriculture, commerce and livestock-raising.

He has been providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi for approximately a year, transporting his passengers along the Cayalti – Zaña - Mocupe route.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase oils and do repairs on his vehicle and in this way continue generating income for his family.

loans.use: To buy oil and do repairs on his vehicle.

loans.name: God's Love Group

texts.en:
God's love is in its ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. This group consists of seven members and is led by Rebecca. The members of this group engage in different businesses such as general goods, cosmetics, clothes, hairdressing, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish, and shoes. Most of these members are into the sale of clothing. 

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Rebecca. She says that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Rebecca currently has a business where she sells Kekkey (cooked corn paste) and fish. She became knowledgeable about selling this type of product by learning the trade from her mother when she was a young girl. Rebecca helped her mother with her business, but after she got married, she decided to establish her own independent business. 

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying corn dough to prepare kenkey and fish. She acquires her merchandise at the fairs in the city of Accra to prepare her kenkey, and then sells from her house. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Rebecca is married and has one child who depends on them. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Rebecca said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy corn dough to prepare kenkey and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, chloride, grease, cream, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances to make the house more comfortable.

loans.name: Ghulam  Hajran

texts.en: Ghulam Hajran, along with her husband, is running a business selling milk. In this way, she can manage her household expenses. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from them on a daily basis. Her husband helps her by selling door-to-door to the people of their community. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to make an extra amount of money. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more cattle. She has a very strong credit history and she always believes that hard work is the key factor of her success. She always advises others to use their loans in a productive manner to do good for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been running a business with her husband selling milk for many years. She has one cow, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Ruqia has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Ruqia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 36-year-old widow. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is the only earning head for her family. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. She is currently in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.  Now she wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy detergents, toiletries and grocery items in large quantities to meet with the increasing demands at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education, health, and food facilities and to increase her business capital

loans.use: to buy detergents, toiletries and grocery items.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 47-year-old, married woman; she has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three buffaloes which she uses to sell milk to the people in her locality. She has four children and is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Azra has become famous for providing good, quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Azra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive change to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es: A sus 25 años de edad carga con una gran responsabilidad y no solo la de criar a sus dos retoños que no superan los 5 años de edad su principal labor es proveer los insumos a la variedad de clientela que hay en el sector pues son campesinos por naturaleza y no hay muchos lugares cercanos que ofrecen estos servicios pues Ángel es el dueño de una de las pocas tiendas generales que operan en la zona y tiene que velar por tener todos los insumos necesarios para abastecer a sus clientes como víveres, granos, carnes, lácteos entre otros quienes tienen que hacer largos desplazamientos en el hipotético caso de no encontrar algo en su tienda y es por esta razón que el señor Ángel Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido y adecuación de su local ya que le importa mucho lo visual y quiere hacer de su local lo más comercial al alcance de su bolsillo proyectando su futuro como el dueño de una cadena de tiendas en toda la ciudad
texts.en: Angel is a 25 year-old who has a lot of responsibilities, including raising his two little ones who are both under the age of 5.  He works providing a variety of products to his customers in the neighborhood, who are farmers by nature.  There are not many places nearby that offer these services.  Angel is the owner of one of the few general stores that operate in the area.  He has to ensure that he has all of the supplies that his customers need, such as groceries, meats, dairy products, and other items. His customers have to travel long distances if they can't find something they need at his store.  This is why Angel is requesting a loan to stock up and recondition his store, because the visual aspect is important, and he wants to make his store the best it can be within his budget.  In the future, he plans to be the owner of a chain of stores throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy supplies and remodel his store to make it more appealing to his customers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer que sufrió del desplazamiento forzado a causa de la violencia, desde hace 1 año vive en Medellín donde comenzó trabajando en casas de familia realizando labores domesticas, luego paso a trabajar como ayudante de cocina, fueron actividades necesarias para el sostenimiento de ella y sus hijos que en ese momento sentían que no tenían esperanza.
Hoy en día decidió montar su propio restaurante el cual ubicara en el barrio San Javier, Medellín.
Ella tiene algunos elementos de trabajo como fogón y asador pero necesita comprar publicidad e insumos de trabajo para poder iniciar, adicionalmente solicita un préstamo para la realización de algunas mejoras locativos en un establecimiento que alquilo para poner allí su restaurante.
Su mayor desafío ha sido levantarse de ese duro golpe que le ha dejado la violencia, que por sus causas perdió a una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a woman who suffered a forced displacement due to the violence and for the last year she has lived in Medellín where she started working in families' homes doing domestic work, later she started working as a cook's assistant. They were jobs necessary to sustain her and her children, who at that time felt as if they had no hope.

These days, she decided to open her own restaurant which she will locate in the San Javier neighborhood of Medellín.

She has some of the equipment for the work such as a stove and grill, but she needs to pay for advertising and supplies to be able to start. In addition, she asks for this loan to do some repairs of a place that she rented to house her restaurant.

Her greatest challenge is to be able to pick herself up after the hard knock given by the violence, which caused her to lose one of her daughters.

loans.use: to pay for publicity and supplies and on-site repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 26-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues to generate healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good, quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 37-year-old, married Ugandan male with four children, aged one and five. He runs a retail and whole sale shop. He is also involved in a fishing business from which he gets additional income. He started his shop business because he had savings from fishing. Despite his progress in these businesses, Robert faces the challenge of limitation in fishing by the authorities. He needs a loan to buy fishing nets as his dream is to expand business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill and supplies for work.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio, su negocio es la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 3 años.  
Doña Hilda las ventas las realiza desde su casa de habitación todos los días de la semana, sus principales clientes son  personas que viven en la zona, en la actualidad  tiene una gran demanda de productos, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio.
Doña Hilda  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, agua, leche, jugos, café, azúcar, pan, frijoles, arroz, aceite, etc. Con estos productos podrá surtir más la pulpería y espera que esta inversión le genere las ganancias necesarias para poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida  y el de su familia. 

Danlí, Honduras – Junio 2014
texts.en:
Hilda is an enterprising woman who works in sales and her business is a grocery store she's operated for the last 3 years. She does the selling from her home every day of the week, and the bulk of her clients is people who live in the area. Currently there's a lot of demand for her products, and she gets up very early to run the store. Hilda is requesting the loan to purchase soft drinks, water, milk, juice, coffee, sugar, bread, beans, rice, oil, etc. With these products she'll be better able to stock the grocery store and she hopes this investment generates the profits necessary to improve she and her family's quality of life.

Danli, Honduras-June 2014

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, water, milk, juice, coffee, sugar, bread, beans, rice, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a pot, work tools and prep supplies.

loans.name: Kaniaz

texts.en: Kaniaz is a 31-year-old married woman.  She has had a business selling milk for a period of about 10 years. She has two cows in milk. She is working hard to provide for her family.  Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, age 38, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Shanta is 32 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 4. Many years ago, she established her cow raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young cow.  

In the future, Shanta plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about eight liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.55. 
 
In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and for capture of methane in storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Denisse Soledad

texts.es:
Denisse es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja como ejecutiva de Ventas en una empresa, y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora y muy atenta y respetuosa con los clientes.
Denisse está muy agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una laptop para poder realizar los pendientes del trabajo y de esta manera crecer profesionalmente y más adelante, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pueda cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en: Denisse is a 21-year-old young entrepreneur. She is single and lives in San Vicente with her family. For about a year, she has been working as a sales executive in a company and is doing very well because she is responsible, hardworking, very caring, and respectful of her clients. Denisse is thankful for Kiva lenders because with the help they have afforded her, she will be able to buy a laptop to be able to complete outstanding work. This way she will grow professionally and move forward with the strength and dedication to be able to fulfill her greatest dream: to have her own business.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for her work.

loans.name: Uzma  Shahzadi

texts.en:
Uzma is a 33-year-old married woman.  She works in the business of plastic moulding; a process of shaping plastic using a rigid frame or mold. She manufactures various objects which are used in making toys. Her husband assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes sufficient income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. In this way, she would be able to purchase a variety of plastics frames and molds. She is hoping for an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastics frames and molds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal, copper, and iron for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To recondition her home's terrace to use it as a dining room for her business and purchase a large pot.

loans.name: Las Lomas De San Juan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan”  está conformado por 05 socios optimistas y responsables que poco a poco han ido mejorando por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de Francy de 27 años es separada y tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al servicio de moto taxi. El deseo de Francy es de seguir trabajando positivamente y así cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el mantenimiento y pintado de su moto taxi. El grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Francy se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa azul.
texts.en: The "Las Lomas De San Juan" group consists of 5 optimistic and responsible members that have gradually improved the welfare of their families. That's the case for 27 year old Francy, a separated woman with 3 dependent children. She works as a motorcycle taxi driver. Francy's aim is to continue working productively and thus pay for household expenses. That's why she requested a loan for maintenance and a paint job for her motorcycle taxi. The "Las Lomas De San Juan" group is grateful to Kiva investors for the help that's been given. Francy is seated on the left side of the photo, wearing a blue jacket.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and a paint job for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 22-year-old single man responsible for the living of the other three members of his family. He has been working as a barber for three years now since he finished his secondary studies.

Rabih is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a special laser machine necessary for his business development needs and customers' requests.

Rabih is well known in his region with his good reputation and special talents. This is his first loan experience with Al Majmoua. He will work hard to develop his business more in the future by diversifying his provided services.

loans.use: to buy a special laser machine

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en:
Georgi sends his thanks and greetings to Kiva lenders and informs them that with the help of his first loan amount he bought a truck for his agricultural business, which turned to be of great use to him. Now he wants to continue his partnership with Kiva for a second time. Georgi lives in the village Sevakar in Syunik region. He has two nice daughters. His wife still works at the kindergarten. With his farming activities he also works at the Kapan as a locksmith. 

Georgi takes care of his farm very properly and he has cattle, chickens, and bees. He sells his farm products such as milk, cheese, eggs, and honey at the city wholesale market. The most popular is his farm’s honey which he sells for its purity and healing qualities. 

Georgi asks a loan of 400.000 Armenian Drams since he has some expenses connected with his beekeeping activities and he must also gather hay for his farm cattle for which he also hasn't enough finances.

loans.use: to buy wax paper for beekeeping and to gather hay for his farm cattle

loans.name: G.s Lirios Del Campo Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es venta de abarrotería desde hace 2  años, este negocio está ubicado en un punto estratégico donde transitan muchas personas y además está cerca de la terminal de buses.
Doña Norma  sus principales clientes son personas que viven en el municipio y otras que van de viaje hacia Danli y Tegucigalpa, mientras esperan que los buses inicien sus recorridos van y le compra sus productos, también se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y a la venta de tortillas.
Doña Norma  solicita el préstamo para compra de leche, azúcar, frijoles, café, pan, arroz, aceite, agua, margarina, quesillo, etc. Y espera que esta inversion le genere las ganancias necesarias para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Uno de  sus sueños es que a través de las ganancias que obtenga su hijo pueda seguir estudiando en la escuela.
Sus compañeros de grupo son Don Carlos quien se dedica a la mecánica desde hace 8 años, 
Don Elmer que se dedica elaboración de ventanas de celosías, cuenta con una vidriera desde hace 1 año.
 Doña Pabla se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales, sopa de mondongo y pan desde hace 7 años, todos ellos solicitan el apoyo a Prisma para poder realizar sus sueños. 

Danlí, Honduras – Junio 2014
texts.en:
Norma is an enterprising woman and has worked in her business, which is selling groceries, for the past 2 years. This business is located in a strategic spot where many people pass by and also is close to the bus terminal. 

Norma's primary customers are people who live in the city and others are those who travel to Danli and Tegucigalpa; while they wait for the buses, they start making the rounds and they purchase her products. Also, she sells American clothing and tortillas.

Norma asks for this loan to purchase milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, rice, oil, water, margarine, farmer's cheese, etc. and hopes that this investment will generate the income necessary to cover the basic necessities. One of her dreams is that through her earnings, her child will be able to continue studying at school. 

Her partners in the group are Carlos who has worked as a mechanic for 8 years, Elmer who works making lattice windows, and has had a window shop for 1 year, and Pabla who has worked making nactamales, sopa de mondongo (traditional Honduran foods) and bread for 7 years. All of them ask for Prisma's help to realize their dreams. 
 

Danlí, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, rice, oil, water, margarine, farmer's cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida, a 31-year-old, married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection on offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. To improve her business, Sajida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colours. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Sajida's seventh loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Basheer

texts.en: Basheer is a 52-year-old married woman. She has six children. Ten years ago she started a business selling milk to bear the everyday expenditures.  She has 2 cows for milk. She sells milk to the people of her community on a daily basis and earns a good amount of income. In order to increase her sales, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR.  The loan will allow her to purchase another cow. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good credit history. She is hoping for an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members' living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Luz Magalis

texts.es:
Uno de las frases más escuchadas en el campo es que una mujer no sirve para llevar un negocio y más si es una agricultura que debe quedarse en la casa aseándola y  cuidando los niños, dicho que Magalis ha roto en su totalidad pues ella es dueña de sus cultivos los trabaja a diario y muy orgullosamente puede decir que este trabajo le ha dado la oportunidad de alimentar y educar sus 6 hijos y no solo eso ha podido sacar adelante a sus padre y hermanos.  
Su único sueño es poder obtener a su nombre las escrituras de sus hectáreas pues por irregularidades de personas  inescrupulosas se ha desviado un poco este asunto pero con fe y trabajo seguirá operando en su terreno ayudándole a su familia a salir adelante.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar la tierra, abonos, riegos y semillas para esperar con ansias una productiva cosecha
texts.en:
One of the sayings most often heard in the countryside is that a woman can't run a business, and also that if she is a farmer, she should stay in the kitchen cleaning it and taking care of the children. These are sayings that Magalis has completely broken since she is the owner of the crops she works daily and very proudly can say that this work has given her the opportunity to feed and educate her 6 children and, not only this, but she has been able to get her father and siblings ahead.   

Her only dream is to be able to get the deeds of her hectares in her name, since due to the irregularities of unscrupulous people, this subject has gone a bit to one side. But with faith and work, she will continue working her land, helping her family get ahead.

She asks for this loan to purchase supplies to prepare the land such as fertilizer, irrigation and seeds to wait anxiously for a productive harvest.

loans.use: to purchase supplies: fertilizer, seeds and irrigation to begin her cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement and bricks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 25-year-old, single man, who works hard to support five other members of his family. Ali studied accounting in a technical school, but unfortunately he couldn't find a suitable job that can fulfill his family's increasing needs. That is why in 2011 he established his own mobile phone shop after working for one year in the field; he found that he is capable of managing his own business. Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards, which will increase his sales and develop both his business and his family's living conditions. Ali is working hard to keep on developing his business in a well-managed way in order to start selling computers and their accessories.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es un un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años de edad , es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Civil en la Universidad, y desde hace más de 7 meses trabaja haciendo planos. Le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabajador, responsable y dedicado a su trabajo.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá pagar los trámites para sacar su Bachiller de Ingeniero Civil y de esta manera buscar un trabajo mejor remunerado, y así, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propia constructora".
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising young man. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in Ica with his family.

At the moment he is studying in the Civil Engineering program at the university and for the past 7 months he has worked making plans. It is going very well for him because he is a person with a strong desire to get ahead, a hard-worker, responsible, and dedicated to his work.

Juan is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered him, he will be able to pay the fees to get his degree in civil engineering and in this way look for better-paying work and, so, with much effort and dedication, in the future, he will be able to get his biggest dream, to have his own construction business.

loans.use: to pay for his degree in civil engineering.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en:
Dolpine is a 27-year-old, single mother of one child who is four years old.  For the last three years, she has been selling both new and used clothes and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

She has applied for a loan of 50,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more clothes for sale.

Dolphine will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 48 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beers, toothpaste, biscuits, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell. Gina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beers, toothpaste, biscuits, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock of bamboo to offer for resell.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo to offer for resell.

loans.name: Jessiren

texts.en:
Jessiren is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessiren is 31-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jessiren has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessiren requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Jessiren has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jessiren would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik continues his entrepreneurial occupation,  and for the success in his business he thanks Kiva lenders that helped him once to repair the enclosed space of his kebab cafe, and enabled him to buy tables, chairs, and tableware to open it for business. Hrachik’s wife helped him greatly in his business and in the city Kapan where they live, and in the region of Syunik they are well known, since they work diligently, and they offer high quality service. 

Before starting his cafe, Harchik worked as a butcher, so he's knowledgeable in choosing fresh, tasty, high quality meat. His customers visit his business throughout the year, but especially in the summer season when they can enjoy the tastiest kebabs in the nice, small gazebos in the open air.

Hrachik is happily awaiting his second loan, which he will use to buy meat and new utensils for his kebab café.

loans.use: to buy meat and also new utensils for his kebab café

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is an honored pedagogue with long years of pedagogical experience. From her first deal with Kiva she is very pleased and very thankful. She bought a computer and some new physics literature with the help of that loan. Seda lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region with her husband, who also has a pedagogical education and he is the director of the local school. As we already know, Seda works at the school and she is a respected and beloved teacher of physics there. 

She also has private courses of physics at her home, and a lot of entrants whom she helps to get prepared for their entrance examinations. Seda asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since she wants to buy some furniture for the room which she separated for her private courses. She finds it pleasant to decorate it with a comfortable table, chairs and shelves for her professional literature.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for the room which she separated for her private courses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a single young man with three dependents living in Bundibugyo Uganda. After testing that retail shop could help him to raise some income to cater for his family, he decided to practice cocoa farming to supplement the small savings he accumulates from his shop, to look after his dependents. He hopes to expand his business to new markets, though transport costs affects him. His an energetic, hardworking man who intends to use the loan to add more stock of cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.use: to add more stock of cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: José Orlando De Jesús

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, es un agricultor que estudio hasta sexto grado de nivel académico,   que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir  sus estudios por situaciones económicas de su padre.  Está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ha procreado 8 hijos;  cuatro de ellos están en la escuela los otro ya no estudian.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20  años,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá que quería que aprendiera bien la agricultura desde entonces ejerce esta actividad; luego se casó y es de la agricultura que está sacando adelante a sus hijos, pero también José se dedica a la venta de verduras cuando no trabaja en la agricultura, sale en su carro por los cantones aledaños a vender frutas y verdura en este negocio se involucra la esposa que junto a ella salen a vender y este oficio lo aprendieron solos, ya que vieron la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos adicional a la agricultura y es así que decidieron poner este negocio, esto lo hace en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 4:00 pm que llegan a la casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitado a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 5 sacos de abono, para regarle a la milpa, ya que ahorita los necesita para que el cultivo sea de muy buen provecho para que le de muchas ganancias. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de frutas y verduras las utiliza para comprar el alimento para sus hijos.  

Los sueños que tiene es que su familia no les falte nada y poder seguir cultivando la tierra para que sus hijos tengan los alimentos y los ingresos suficientes para que ellos sigan estudiando y que siempre siga vendiendo las frutas para que así no les falte el dinero y poder seguir comprando y surtir más el negocio y en un futuro comprar un carro más nuevo.
texts.en:
José, 46, is a farmer who studied until the sixth grade. He learned this work from his father who wanted him to understand farming well. Since then he has been doing this work. He later married and is a farmer moves his family forward. However, José also works in the sale of vegetables when he isn't working in agriculture. He goes out in his car to the neighboring towns to sell fruits and vegetables. His wife is also involved in the business as she goes with him to sell. It is a self-taught trade. Since they needed to find an additional source of income apart from agriculture, they decided to start this business. They work a schedule from 6:00 in the morning and it is 4:00 in the afternoon when they arrive home. 

The loan requested from CREDICAMPO is to purchase five sacks of fertilizer to place on the cornfields. Right now they need it because the crop is in high demand and brings in a good profit. The earnings obtained from the sale of fruits and vegetables are used to buy food for their children. 

He dreams that his family will never lack anything and to be able to continue farming the land so that his children will have food, sufficient income so his children can continue studying. He also hopes to continue selling fruits so that they aren't lacking in money so they can continue buying and stocking the business, and eventually buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizers to plant in the cornfield.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married father of one child, who has been working as a technician in a television station since six years ago. His business is very far from his house and the means of transportation are very hard to achieve.

Ali is a hard working man, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for his transportation to work since he lives in a far away village.

He hopes that one day he can start his own business and develop his family's living in a well managed way.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for his transportation to work since he lives in a far away village

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran hopes to have his second deal with Kiva and already the sixth one with Nor Horizon. He needed his first Kiva loan for the purchase of some bee colonies, a cow, and fodder for his farm animals. He lives in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region.

Tigran graduated from a technological secondary school, and after that he worked as an electrician for 17 years. After that he started beekeeping and farming. In his farm, Tigran breeds cows, sheep, and chickens and he also has a lot of beehives. Tigran is married and their single son now lives and works in Russian Federation. Only his wife helps Tigarn in his farming activates. From his farm he manages to sell meat, eggs, and very pure and healing honey for which he has a lot of loyal customers.

This time Tigran needs this loan in order to buy all the necessary things for beekeeping, such as frames, wax papers, and also some more beehives.

loans.use: to buy all the necessary things for beekeeping, such as frames, wax papers, and also some more beehives.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. 

Maria is borrowing 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Maria has been raising goats for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rosini

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosini works hard to support her family.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosini is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rosini has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 34-years-old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, detergent soap, candies, etc. 

Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 34-years-old and married with five children.

Janeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Janeth has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Janeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Victory” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in chorkor-Accra, Ghana. This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from ID-Ghana. With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. They are into the sale of foodstuff, cosmetics, and cow-leg meat. 

The featured borrower of this group is Victoria. Victoria is age 53 and she is currently residing together with her husband and one child in Accra. Her husband is a civil worker and her child is attending school. For nine years now, Victoria has been selling cosmetics. With this loan, she will buy more cosmetics at wholesale price and add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics at wholesale price and add to her business.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro de 67 años de edad, es un agricultor que estudio hasta 3º grado en la escuela,  ya que sus padres no pudieron  enviarlo a la escuela por razones económicas.

 Actualmente está casado junto a su esposa han procreado dos hijos los cuales ya no viven junto a él por qué están acompañados.

Isidro es un agricultor que prácticamente desde  que tenía 14 años de edad y desde entonces se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol,  su padre quien ya falleció le dejo una herencia de dos hectáreas las cuales son la que cultiva este año, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre  quien ya falleció y desde entonces él es agricultor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  abonos, foliares y  paga de mano de obra de los jornaleros que le ayudan a sembrar dicho cultivo, la distancia donde tiene su cultivo está prácticamente a un costado de su casa ya que cultiva donde su padre le dejo la herencia.

Isidro tiene un anhelo en la vida que sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia lo podrá lograr y es llegar a tener su vivienda digna y que junto a su esposa pueda vivir en un lugar más seguro de las lluvias.
texts.en: Isidro is a 67 year old farmer who went to school up to the 3rd grade, since his parents weren't able to send him to school for financial reasons. Currently he's married and he and his wife have two kids, neither of whom live with him because they formed their own households. Isidro has practically been a farmer since he was 14 and ever since he has grown corn and beans. He inherited two hectares of land from his deceased father and that's where he's planting this year. His departed dad taught him this work and he's been farming ever since. The loan he's requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase manure, fertilizers and pay day laborers to help him plant his crop. Distance-wise his crop is basically located right next to his house since he's farming the land he inherited from his father. Isidro has one desire in life and he knows he can achieve it with lots of work and determination, it's to have a respectable home and live with his wife in a place that's more protected from the rain.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and pay day laborers to help him plant his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is a 29-year-old, married man who established his own barber shop to start developing his career path ten years ago. Prior to owning his own shop he was employed for five consecutive years in this domain to acquire special talents and customers' trust. Husein left school during elementary, thus for this reason he had to work early to acquire a profession that will help him make his living. Husein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to decorate his shop to attract new customers and develop his business. This will be his second loan cycle; his previous loan was invested to pay for his wedding expenses. He hopes to keep on developing his business through updating his talents and workplace upon customers' requests.

loans.use: to decorate his shop to attract new customers and develop his business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years-old, married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for 3 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Mary Ann is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell in her used clothing business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli is one of the many Kiva clients that liked her first loan very much and hopes for a second one. Her first loan helped her to buy a computer. She has a higher pedagogical education (she has 35 years of pedagogical experience) and she is a teacher of Russian language and literature in the village of Fioletovo. Nelli lives with her husband in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Her husband is a sculptor. Nelli also gives paid private courses of Russian language and literature and helps her pupils to get ready for their entrance examinations. Nelli is requesting her second Kiva loan to buy some professional literature, to furnish the room in her house where she provides her courses, and to purchase a computer table for her computer.

loans.use: to furnish the room in her house where she provides courses for her pupils and to buy a computer table.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is a 47-year-old married woman with three children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Digna has a fertilized duck egg vending business in the Philippines. Digna requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

Digna has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Digna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Humberto Segundo

texts.es:
Humberto ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes en el municipio de Sincelejo.
Es un padre amoroso y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.
El siempre fue muy inquieto y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.
Hoy en día es un hombre amable y muy emprendedor, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. Adicionalmente desea comprar algunos cerdos de cría y así obtener unos ingresos extra para su familia.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Humberto has acquired significant, pleasant experiences in his life; one of which is having worked in various grocery stores in the town of Sincelejo. He is a loving and responsible father who is very aware of the meaning of family in his productive process. He has always been very restless with a great dedication to service - qualities that motivated him to open his own grocery store and make it well recognized in his town. 

Today he is a friendly, entrepreneurial man who is always looking for alternatives for his customers to feel well cared for and with high quality products. He is applying for a loan to buy an assortment of general store products since he plans to increase his product offering and hopes to have a much larger inventory. This way he will be able to have products available for his customers. Additionally, he hopes to buy a few pigs to raise and thus make extra profit for his family. His greatest dream is to be able to own a large food distribution company which he believes he will gradually achieve.

loans.use: to buy products for his shop and to buy breeding pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Upon joining Gakui group, Jane met the requirement needed to get an agricultural asset funding from Juhudi Kilimo. Jane is a mother of 3 whose main income source for the last 25 years has been tea. She is now transforming to pursue her dream of farming; more particularly, goat farming.

Jane lives in Kerugoya Kenya. She enjoys selling her produce and making returns. Her biggest challenges are raising funds and unavailability of affordable labor.

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase a goat. The demand for mutton is very high in Kenya. With your loan, Jane will diversify into goat farming and greatly boost her income. With the increased money, she is going to pay school fees for her children. She stated that the loan will help her family to get enough food and lead an improved way of life.

loans.use: To purchase a goat.

loans.name: Yaser Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yaser Al- Hodeidah. It consists of three ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB.

Ahlam is a hardworking woman. She is a 30-year-old divorced woman and a mother of two children. Her oldest child is 10 years old and the second one is 7 years old. She is the leader of the group. Ahlam has started her business of selling women's clothes as a door-to-door business for one year. After she got divorced, Ahlam assumed the responsibility of her children. 

Ahlam started her business with a small capital. Year by year her business improves more, but most of what she earns from profits go to the expenses of the children. She has good experience in the business. Thanks to her experiences, she deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of ready-made women's clothes and resell them to her customers. She looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a small shop for selling ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper, soap, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Lucresia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucresia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, cereals, creamer, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, and vinegar to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, creamer, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, vinegar, etc. 

Lucresia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, cereals, creamer, coffee, shampoo, detergent soap,and vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 61 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luisa has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Luisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.en:
Marlinda works hard to support her family. Marlinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marlinda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Marlinda has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Editha has been in this business for 6 years now.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 40 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que solo logro estudiar hasta 1º año de bachillerato y no pudo terminar sus estudios porque su padre ya no tenía las facilidades económicas para seguir pagando sus estudios.

 Actualmente trabaja como jornalero en los trabajos agrícolas y también realiza sus propios cultivos también forma parte de la directiva ADESCO de su comunidad, él no está casado ni tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre y su padre.

Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora que no sabe tener obstáculos para realizar cualquier trabajo, él se levanta todos los días a las cinco de la mañana a trabajar en la agricultura, ya que renta unas tierras para trabarlas sembrando maíz, este año ha sembrado lo que es una hectárea de terreno, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre quien también es agricultor, la distancia que tiene que caminar para ir hasta donde está su cultivo no es mucha, ya que solo está a un  kilómetro de distancia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más abono para su cultivo de maíz. El cultivo ya fue sembrado y también ya se realizó la primera abonada y  hacen falta dos riegos de abono y no tiene el efectivo para comprarlos.  

Él tiene planeado sacar dos cosechas en el año, ya que el año pasado le dio mucha rentabilidad y le produjo 62 quintales de maíz,  ahora este año va a hacer dos cosechas y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 40 years old, is a very hard-working man who only managed to go to school through the first year of high school and was not able to finish his studies because his father didn't have the economic facility to continue paying for his education.

Now he works as a day laborer doing agricultural work, and he also plants his own crops. He is also part of the ADESCO [a community development organization] directive of his community. He is not married and has no children. He lives with his mother and his father.

Carlos is a very hard-working person who knows no obstacles to doing any kind of work. He gets up every day at 5 in the morning to work in agriculture, since he rents some land to work. He plants corn. This year he has planted a hectare of land. He learned this work from his father, who is also a farmer. The distance that he has to walk to go to his fields isn't much, since it's only a kilometer away.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy more compost for his planting of corn. The crop is already planted, and he has also already done the first application of compost. Two applications of compost are [still] needed, and he doesn't have the cash to pay for them.

He plans to get two harvests in a year, since last year it was very profitable for him and produced 62 quintals [a quintal is approximately 100 lbs] of corn. Now this year he is going to make two harvests, and he knows that he can achieve it with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy more compost for his corn crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 41-year-old married man with two children. His oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old. Taha lives with his family in their own house which located in Taiz city, Yemen. He is an educated man with a university education. Due to high rates of the unemployment in the country, Taha couldn't find a job to look after his family. Recently, he was an unemployed. Taha didn't surrender to that condition. He strives strongly to improve the condition of his family. He is a very dynamic and vigorous man. Over time he accumulated enough money to purchase a piece of land. Now Taha is the sole breadwinner of his family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the house. Thus, he lives in a miserable condition, but he could built his own house on the land. But still it is not completed. As a result, Taha requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to complete the building of his house.

Taha's dream in the future is to complete the building of his house and renovating it. He hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Maravillas” está conformada por 06 socios optimistas con deseos de superación. Gina es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica al servicio de amada de casa de lunes a viernes. A sus 49 años Gina ha logrado mejorar su situación económica. Como actividad secundaria los fines de semanas se dedica a la venta de comida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, carne de res y pescado. Su mayor deseo es de crecer en su negocio llegando a más clientes. El grupo “Las Maravillas” agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito ya que hace posible su progreso. Gina es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Maravillas" is made up of six optimistic members with aspirations of success. Gina is separated and has one dependent child.
She works as a housekeeper Monday through Friday. At 49 years of age, Gina has achieved an improvement in her financial situation. 

As a second job, she sells food on weekends. She requests a loan to buy rice, beef and fish. Her greatest desire is to grow her business and reach more clients. 

The group "Las Maravillas" thanks those people that made this loan a reality since it makes possible their progress. 

Gina is the first from the left.

loans.use: to buy rice, beef and fish

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old and married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 6 years. Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Meet Jemimah. She is a small-scale farmer determined to raise the quality of life being led by her child. She lives together with her family at Kerugoya, Kenya. For the last 5 years, she has been farming and selling her crop production into the local market. She also engages in other seasonal businesses such as rabbits
Jemimah is seeking a loan to purchase a goat. Goats are among the main meat-producing animals in Kenya. Chevon is quickly becoming the choicest meats with huge domestic demands. Farmers like Jemimah are focusing on the economic prospects.
From your loan, the money Jemimah will make from keeping goats will cover other business related expenses that she is struggling with right now. When she was asked how the loan will benefit her family, Jemima replied 'They will get enough food.'
Jemima’s dream is to become a well-recognized commercial goat farmer

loans.use: to purchase a goat

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
Luis de 38 de edad, es un agricultor de la zona, estudio hasta quinto grado en la escuela de su cantón y no siguió sus estudios ya que para esa época todos las gastos educativos tenían que ser pagados por los padres y para ese entonces la crisis económica que vivian era muy dura y no pudo seguir con sus estudios, actualmente está acompañado pero no tiene hijos.

Luis tiene alrededor de 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura,  esta actividad fue heredada por  su padre quien le enseño a cultivar maíz y frijol, pero hace 3 años atrás un amigo le enseño la actividad de ganadería, que es la compra venta de ganado bovino y también la compra de ganado de repasto, ahora se dedica a dos actividades ganadería y agricultura y le va muy bien en ambas actividades.

El dinero de este préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para el cultivo de maíz, ya que en este año cultivara lo que son dos hectáreas de maíz y comprara 18 sacos de abono que están valorados en $48 c/u haciendo un total de $864 él ya cuenta con $200 para los demás gastos así que solo necesita $800 para solventar lo que sus necesidades y poder sacar adelante su cosecha.

Él tiene planeado sacar su cultivo con la mejor cosecha posible, ya que con este crédito podrá dar un excelente mantenimiento a su cultivo libre de plagas, con esto sabe que podrá vender un producto de la mejor calidad y obtener mejores ganancias pagar su crédito y además las ganancias las puede invertir en la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Luis, age 38, is a farmer from the area. He studied through the fifth grade at the school in his canton. Luis could not continue his studies at the time because his parents were responsible for his educational expenses. Since the economic crisis at the time was very hard, they could not help him continue his studies. Luis is currently in a relationship, but does not have children.

He has already worked in agriculture for 10 years. The trade was passed down from his father, who taught him how to cultivate corn and beans. However, three years ago, a friend introduced him to raising livestock, especially buying and selling cattle. Luis also buys cattle for grazing. Now that he spends time in both activities, farming and raising livestock, he is doing well in both of them.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies for cultivating corn. This year he will be planting two hectares of corn, so he will buy 18 sacks of compost valued at $48/each, which comes to a total of $864. Luis already has $200 for other expenses, so he only needs $800 to take of care of these needs and move forward with his planting.

He hopes to achieve the best crop possible. This loan will enable him to provide the best care to his crops so that they remain free of pests. Luis knows that he can sell a high quality product and generate good profits so that he can repay his loan. In addition, his earnings can be reinvested into the next crop.

loans.use: to buy 18 sacks of compost.

loans.name: Abdulhafez

texts.en:
Abdulhafez is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his family consisting of 8 members in Mafraq/Jordan. Abdulhafez is a university student majoring in jurisprudence, and he is in his third year. He is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he doesn't have enough money to do so.

Abdulhafez wants to support his family financially after he gets his Bachelors' degree.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Merlin requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Merlin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to use improved seed to establish a pasture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and paint to build an outdoor sink (for washing clothes, etc.) with a bathroom and to paint the walls of his home.

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, gracias a sus padres estudio hasta  3º año bachillerato, luego estudio un técnico mecánico con el que posteriormente se dedico a trabajar con lo que había aprendido. Su compañera de vida se dedica a trabajar en los oficios domésticos y tiene una hija que es menor de edad que no esta estudiando hasta el próximo año.

josé tenia un trabajo como mecánico en la ciudad, donde tenia que viajar todos los días para ese lugar desde la mañana hasta por la tarde, esto lo hizo durante 3 años; luego empezó a atender clientes por su cuenta en un taller que fue formando comprando herramientas para trabajar, esta profesión la aprendió en la escuela pero en el taller de un amigo fue donde pudo adquirir experiencia en esta actividad.
