Doña Patricia es una señora muy valiente y trabajadora, estilista de profesión y ocupación, atiende clientas en su casa, en un pequeño espacio, además visita clientas a domicilio, para cortes de pelo, tintes, y todo tipo de tratamientos para cabello. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita, y lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos para su trabajo, como tintes, keratinas, tratamientos de cuidado y otros. 
La actividad que realiza la clienta es una única fuente de ingresos que recibe su familia, es por eso que la inversión de capital de trabajo es vital para fortalecer su negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijas. Junto a Doña Patricia integran el grupo 3 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y artesanales.
texts.en:
Patricia is one member of the women's communal bank named "Las Triunfadoras". She is 38 years old, divorced and the head of her household. Patricia has two daughters: the youngest is in high school while the eldest is doing a course to learn a profession and to be able to help her mother. Patricia is a very brave and hard-working woman. She is a stylist and looks after her customers in a small place at her home. She also visits customers at their home to do hair cuts, dyes and all sorts of hair treatments. This is Patricia's second loan; she will invest it in buying supplies for her work, such as dyes, keratins, care treatments and more.

This work is Patricia's only source of income for her family. As a result, this investment is vital for strengthening her business and improving Patricia and her daughters' quality of life. Alongside Patricia, this group has three other members who will invest in their businesses and artisan work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as dyes, keratins, treatments and more.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 63 años de edad es viuda vive sola en casa propia, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Cecilia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, etc. para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cecilia is 63 years old and a widow; she lives alone in a house that she owns. For over ten years Cecilia has been working selling personal items. She sells these goods as a street vendor in the different around near her house. Cecilia has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices. With what she earns from her sales, Cecilia is able to cover some household costs. Cecilia is applying for a loan in order to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions and more in order to continue making sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions and more.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila tiene 59 años de edad es casada y habita en casa propia junto a su familia. Zoila y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración y venta de escobas a base de escobilla la cual muchas veces la cultivan y en ocasiones la compran. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos a tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de la materia prima (escobilla) para continuar haciendo las escobas y poder contar con mayor capacidad y cubrir una mayor demanda.
texts.en: Zoila is 59 years old, married and lives in the house that she owns with her family. Zoila and her husband make a living making and selling brushes. Zoila and her husband often grow their own bristles for the brushes, while sometimes they buy them. This business is the couple's main source of income and so they want to keep it going for a long time. With a desire to improve their sales and income, the couple has decided to apply for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to invest in buying prime materials (bristles) for continuing to make brushes.  With a greater production capacity, the couple can meet higher demand.

loans.use: to buy bristles for making brushes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical exams and tests.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 41 años de edad y junto a su esposo han procreado tres hijos quienes tiene 21 años, 17 años y 10 años de edad. Elisa se dedica a la compra y venta de verdura y granos básicos desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza tanto de manera ambulante como de manera fija. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es lo que le permite ajustar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Elisa desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de maíz y verduras para la venta.
texts.en: Elisa is 41 years old and, with her husband, has three children, aged 21, 17 and 10 years old respectively. Elisa has been making a living selling vegetables and basic grains for a long time. She works both as a street vendor and has a fixed stall where she sometimes sells her goods. This business provides Elisa with her main source of income and it allows her to cover household costs. Elisa wants to invest in her business and so is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy corn and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad desde hace varios años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también posee una tortillería, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor como: granos básicos, golosinas, verduras, refrescos, frutas, aceite, detergentes, etc. Para surtir más la tienda y generar mejores ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old and for a number of years has had a small shop that she runs out of her home. In addition Maria has a tortilla stand and, with the money from sales and with help from her husband, she is able to cover some household costs. Maria is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as basic grains, sweets, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, oil, detergents and more. She will buy these items in order to stock up her shop and to generate a higher income in order to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, vegetables, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, oil, detergents and more.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida por encargo, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de menú que tiene en sus platos de comida y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, verduras, frutas, maíz, refrescos, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and son. María makes a living selling food on order. María runs her business out of her home. She has many customers because of the variety of dishes she offers and the good prices. The money that María earns from sales helps her to cover household costs. María is applying for this loan in order to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, corn, soft drinks, beans and more. With this loan María can continue with sales and enjoy a higher quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, corn, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 7 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el cultivo de tomates, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno para seguir realizando las siembra y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his family. For 7 years he has worked in agriculture. His main job is to grow tomatoes. He sells his products at different markets, which are near his place of residence. With what he makes from his sales he pays for his household expenses. The client is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, organic fertilizers, plague controls, herbicides, etc., and to improve the soil so he can keep on growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, organic fertilizers, plague controls, herbicides, etc. and to improve the soil

loans.name: Jovid

texts.ru: Човиду 23 года. Он умный и начитанный молодой человек. Он студент 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Он учится по специальности политолога. Он проживает в сельской местности и там мало специалистов по политологии.  После окончания университета он хочет работать в своем селе.  Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jovid is 23. He is a smart, well-read young man in his second year at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He studies political science. He lives in a rural area where there are few specialists in this field. After graduation he wants to work in his village. He needs to pay for his tuition but does not have enough money, so he has asked for a loan. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She has no  additional family members. Justine sells charcoal at the market for retail. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 1 year. Justine gets additional income from also selling vegetables at the market on a retail basis.
She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. Justine's goal and aspiration is to increase her sales but this would only be through increase in capital. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee una negocio de venta de recuerdos para bodas, quince años, bautizos y adornos para el hogar, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas sostiene los gastos que se le presentan en  su hogar, la clienta  solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor, para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: The client is 28 years old and lives in her own house with her domestic partner and her two children. She owns a business of party favors for weddings, 15 year old parties, christenings and home ornaments. With the income from her sales she pays for her household expenses. The client is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family's.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks, basic grains, soups, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying more goods such as butter, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mauro Antonio

texts.es: Mauro de 50 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas y adicional vende los fines de semanas por la noche pupusas, con su trabajo  ayuda a su familia a solventar todas sus necesidades de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Mauro solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las totillas y asi obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mauro is a 50-year old man who sells tortillas on a daily basis and "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) on weekend nights. Thanks to his job, he is able to support his family and cover household expenses. They live in their own house. 

Mauro is requesting a loan to buy quintals of corn as well as lime to make tortillas. This way he could obtain more income and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn as well as lime.

loans.name: Heidy Marisol

texts.es: Heidy tiene 27 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de un año de edad en casa familiar. Heidy se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa como faldas, blusas y pantalones dado que desea mejorar su negocio de venta de ropa y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Heidy, age 27, lives in the family house with her life partner and her little one year old daughter.  Heidy earns a living by selling clothes in an itinerant manner.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of clothes like skirts, blouses, and pants.  This is because she wishes to improve her business of selling clothes.  This way she will be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes like skirts, blouses, and pants for her business.

loans.name: Exilia

texts.en:
Exilia, a true example of the Haitian female entrepreneur, has worked very hard to make her dream come true. Years ago, she was just a street vendor selling only candies and cookies. Despite her daily life challenges, she has successfully generated enough income to expand her business. She has added value to her products and altered her business strategy to remain viable during difficult times in Haiti. 

Exilia has invested more than 75% of the business’ net income as retained earnings in the business every year. Like any successful owner, she always strives to do things not only well, but also right and profitably. 

In order to do that, the business needs to provide better and cheaper products and provide them faster than its competitors to make a better profit. To achieve that business goal efficiently, the business is challenged to buy a new generator and more food products. A loan will be crucial to the business’ forward momentum.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and food products. The business intends to widen the business facility and improve quality and quantity of services to maximize profit by 20% while serving everyone in the Delmas 18 community.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jacklie lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with one child and is not in school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells green bananas on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years. She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include transportation and thieves. 

Her goal and aspiration is to start selling other types of food like sweet potatoes, cassava, and beans.She can only afford this when her loan amounts have been increased. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green banana

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Afuswa

texts.en:
Afuswa lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children and one goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells milk at the market on retail basis. She operates her business in a shop that she rents.She works six days a week .She has been in this business for the last two years. She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy gallons of milk, loaves of bread, and Blue Band (margarine). 

Her major challenges include electricity and the perishability of the milk she sells. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy gallons of milk, bread, and Blue Band (margarine)

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad  vive con sus hijos en casa propia, ellos le  ayudan con el negocio, ya que ella posee una venta de pupusas ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Ana  solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijol, queso, chicharrón, tomates, etc. Para obtener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su familia  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 49-year old woman who lives with her children in her own house. She owns a business of "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) located at her house and counts with the help of her children. Thanks to this job, she can cover household expenses. 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, tomatoes, etc. This way she could obtain more income and enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad, vive con su grupo familiar conformado por  su esposo y sus hijos, ambos  trabajan, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicad en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos,  granos básicos, sopas, azúcar, etc. para surtir aun mas su tienda y así  darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 54-year old woman who lives with her husband and children. She owns a small store located at her house and uses the income she obtains to cover some household expenses. 

María is requesting a loan to buy candy, sodas, basic grains, soups, sugar, etc. so that she can stock her store and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, sodas, basic grains, soups, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with two children and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She provides services of outside catering. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works only on weekends. She gets additional income from  teaching. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy food warmers. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to see her business expand into a hotel. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy food warmers

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Doña Santos de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Santo solicita un crédito para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poderles dar  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, age 46, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She has devoted herself to agriculture for ten years.  She grows corn and sorghum.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost, etc.  She will also use the loan to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph.  This way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marina Lizeth

texts.es: Marina tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Marina posee una tienda en la cual distribuye variedad de productos como: azúcar, sal, aceite, golosinas, café, pan dulce, huevos, especies, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de cubrir una demanda más grande y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito dado que desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería como: cereales, detergente, aceite, café, golosinas, pan dulce, especies, etc.
texts.en:
Marina is a 24-year old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Marina owns a store where she sells a variety of products, including sugar, salt, oil, candy, coffee, sweet bread, eggs, spices, etc. Thanks to this job and that of her husband, they can cover household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan with the aim to meet a larger demand and provide her family with better life conditions. She plans to use the loan to buy products, such as cereals, detergents, oil, coffee, candy, sweet bread, spices, etc.

loans.use: to buy cereals, detergent, oil, coffee, candy, sweet bread, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a small motorcycle for delivering food

loans.name: Las Angelitas Group

texts.en:
The large indigenous town of Chichicastenango, located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, is well-known among travelers for its huge and colorful Thursday and Sunday markets. Many of the narrow streets are of old cobblestones, and the buildings are roofed with red tiles. This picturesque setting disguises the poverty that the majority of the citizens of Chichicastenango experience on a daily basis. The unstable economy of the country has a drastic effect on poor families. The majority of the households are sustained by women who do their best to take care of their families with very limited resources.

Cecilia is the president of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Angelitas,” meaning “The Little Angels.” She is widowed and works quite hard to take care of her six children. Cecilia is on her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She has a textile business and sells traditional blouses (“huipiles”) and skirts (“cortes”) throughout the country. Cecilia is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase thread and other supplies. She plans to diversify her designs to attract new clientele and increase her income.

The ladies of the Trust Bank would not be as successful in their personal and business lives if it wasn’t for the educational component of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer, sensitive to their needs and desires, presents short seminars on a variety of timely subjects, and the women are very eager to learn. Empowered by the information, they can design a business plan, learn about accounting, budgeting, marketing and pricing. The ladies also learn about health, nutrition, the use of medicinal plants, and hygiene. 

Cecilia emphasizes that this educational component is very valuable and makes the women even more empowered and successful. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the loans and education “Microcredit Plus.”

Kiva investors are valuable partners for the women in the Trust Bank and are greatly appreciated. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on these hard-working ladies, “Las Angelitas.” Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase thread and other supplies for making textiles.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is an energetic and diligent woman of 53 years from Maynaguri. She is married to Dinesh, age 56 years. Lalita studied till grade 8 and her husband has a secondary education. They have two sons. Both of their sons are students. One is in grade 7; the other is in college.

Lalita's husband is a farmer. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. But his income is scanty to cover all the expenses of the family. So to help her husband, Lalita is also engaged in livestock breeding. A few years ago, she established herself in raising dairy cows for a milk supply business.  She works seven days a week, five hours a day to support her family. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in rural India, especially in West Bengal. Cows are raised for their milk to make butter, curd and paneer (cottage cheese). In addition, milk cows provide cow dung, which is used as fuel for fires and good manure in agricultural lands. So raising dairy cows is a profitable business. 

At present, Lalita has two cows in her herd. She wants to increase the number, which can be possible through a loan. So Lalita has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more dairy cow to further extend her milk supply and milk products business. Lalita plans to improve the economic condition of her family by the additional income and provide better education to her children.

She thanks her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Kanebala

texts.en:
Kanebala is a very energetic woman of 30 years. She is from a small village Khagrabari at Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district where she lives with her husband and two school-going daughters. She and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only. But they are providing education to their daughters with great difficulties. Their daughters read in different grades (grade 5 and grade 1).

Kanebala's husband, Niren, has a small business. He buys food items from wholesale markets and supplies the local retail shops. He has to raise a family of four members with his meager income but these days it is very difficult to maintain all the household expenses with his income. Now, Kanebala wants to extend her helping hands to her husband. She wants to start a business of renting a generator machine in the local market at the time of load shedding and so she wants to purchase a generator machine.

With this aim, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She wants to use the loan to purchase a generator machine and other necessary items to start the business initially.

Her greatest dream is to give proper education to her daughters. She wants to generate better income so that she can fulfill her dream.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a generator machine.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 29-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and two school-going children in the small village Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud). Her children are in grades 4 and 7. Her husband is a van puller who rents from a local owner. Arati studied only up to grade 4 due to her parental monetary problems.

Arati 's husband works under a local van owner.  He has no fixed income. He is the only earning member for the family, but he is unable to make sufficient income. They are facing acute financial problems and he is unable to give a decent lifestyle to the family and bear the educational cost of his children.

For this reason Arati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cycle-van of her own. For generating more income her husband will deliver goods and vegetables to market shops and will earn a livelihood for the family. He can also give the cycle van on hire for additional income. Their high volume of work will produce a steady income to her family and it enable her to overcome the financial hurdles of the family. With the profit she hopes that she will be able to upgrade her family and give better education to her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS both.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her own business purpose.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a 22-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and two children in the small village Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud). Her children are too small to go to school. Her husband is a rickshaw puller who rents from a local owner. Dipa studied up to grade 5 but could not study further due to her parental poverty.

Dipa 's husband works under a local rickshaw owner on daily wages. He has no fixed income. He is the only earning member for the family, but he is unable to make sufficient income. They are facing acute financial problems and he is unable to give a decent lifestyle to the family and bear the cost of raising his children.

For this reason Dipa has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a rickshaw of her own. For generating more income her husband will deliver goods and vegetables as well as people to the market shops and will earn a livelihood for the family. He can also give the rickshaw on hire for additional income. Their high volume of work will produce a steady income to her family and it will enable her to increase her profit to overcome the financial hurdles of the family. With the profit she hopes that she will be able to upgrade her family and dreams to purchase an auto rickshaw in future for further income.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS both.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her own business purpose.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his garage.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un prestamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She has made a living for many years by raising farm animals. She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 500 nuevos soles, which she will use to purchase balanced feed to fatten the animals so that she can earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten small animals.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 66 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one daughter now at her adult age.
 
For her means of living, Lilia has been engaged in managing a sari-sari (convenience) store that has sold groceries and other consumable products for 25 years. She earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she is receiving a monthly pension from her service rendered in the local government of her town. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for retail.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 49 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now at their adult age.

For her means of living, Pablita has been engaged in managing a sari-sari (convenience) store that sells groceries and other consumable products for just five months. She earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for retail.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Pablita hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Jhumki

texts.en:
Jhumki is a 32-year-old woman of Maynaguri. She lives with her husband and two children. Neither she nor her husband completed their secondary level of education. Her children are now receiving education in grades 2 and 7.

Though her husband runs a small business of his own, his income is not sufficient for household expenses and the children’s education as well. That is why Jhumki has to face lots of financial hurdles. For this reason she decided to help her husband and contribute to her family on her own. 

She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine for making cotton garments like blouses, petticoats, frocks, etc. As she has a sound knowledge of stitching from her childhood, she has chosen this tailoring business to start. She hopes she can earn sufficiently from this business because there is no good tailor nearby and people have to go to the proper town to meet their needs. Due to this demand of daily use garments in her locality, Jhumki started her new tailoring business with a hope that she will earn huge profits. With the profit, she hopes to give more education to her children, to protect them from poverty and to relieve the family’s financial difficulties and enhance her family’s well-being.

Now Jhumki hopes to become a renowned tailor in her locality, and she gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for starting her own new tailoring business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jujie

texts.en:
Jujie is 32 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their school age. 

For their means of living, Jujie has been engaged in managing a motorcycle for hire business for 13 years already, with her husband as the driver. The couple earns approximately 1,500 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing motorcycle spare parts for maintenance and repair of their unit.

Jujie has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Jujie hopes to acquire an additional unit of motorcycle transport for hire.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for maintenance and repair

loans.name: Grabiel Vitabier

texts.es:
Gabriel Vitabier tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios como operario de construcción civil, realizando esta actividad desde hace varios años, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de frutas de estación para ofrecerlo al por mayor a sus clientes que son las juguerias y restaurants de su distrito y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriel Vitabier is 41 years old. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a  hot climate. It is calm, and its residents make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

He provides services as an operator in civil construction. He has been doing this for many years and also sells seasonal fruits. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of seasonal fruits in bulk to offer to his customers, which are juice stores and restaurants in his area. This way, he will be able to generate additional income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seasonal fruits for juice stores.

loans.name: Talla

texts.fr: Talla est un aviculteur de profession. Il est marié et père de famille qui habite dans le même quartier que le guichet. Il est à son 3ème prêt et sollicite celui-ci pour acheter des poussins et aliments pour pratiquer son activité qui est l’aviculture. Il a une expérience de 5 ans et démarre sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 20h. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  TALLA souhaite acheter un grand champ dans le village environnant et y pratiquer son activité, ainsi il pourra diversifier et augmenter ses revenus. Il pourra aussi épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Talla is a poultry farmer by  trade. He is married and has children. They live in the neighborhood where our branch is located. Talla is seeking his third loan to buy chicks and fodder for his poultry business. He has five years of experience and starts at 10 AM to finish at 8 PM. He provides for the everyday household needs and the school fees of his children. Talla would like to by a large field in a nearby village in order to diversify his business and increase his revenues. In this way, he will be able to grow his savings and improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and fodder for his poultry business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Marina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Niyati

texts.en:
Niyati is a married woman of 50 years.  She is from the village Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district. She lives there with her husband, Harendra, and two sons.  She studied till grade 9 and her husband, to 7.  One of their sons is in college and the elder one works as a laborer on daily wages.

Niyati's husband is associated with agricultural activities.  He mainly grows paddy rice and vegetables like potatoes. As he has grown old and feeble, Niyati has also engaged herself in this business. They have their own plot of land, where they work from dawn to dusk.  Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her sons and her family.  But the income from this business is very inconsistent and at the same time insufficient to cover all the necessary expenses of the family.  She cannot invest much in this business due to lack of capital.  Now she has decided to grow jute, which is a profitable crop.

Niyati heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives business loans to needy rural women.  She took a loan from them with an aim to cultivate jute. She wants to use the loan to buy planting seeds and fertilizer to start the cultivation.  She is striving for a better life through farming.  Niyati hopes to have a better life with her family in future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

______________________________________________________________________________

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, pesticides, fertilizers) to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 45 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ruth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ruth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Esterlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Esterlita is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Esterlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy paint, wood, bamboo and other materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 45 years. Arsenia earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, bamboo and other materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mousumi

texts.en:
Mousumi is a very energetic woman of 25 years.  She is married and a housewife.  She is blessed with two daughters who are students in different grades of primary school.  Mousumi attended school up to grade 7 and could not continue further education due to the poverty of her parents. She lives with her husband, Sudeb, and her daughters in Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Mousumi's husband has a business of farming paddy rice and selling his crops in the local market.  As rice is the staple food to the local people, so this is a lucrative business.  He works hard on his land and Mousumi also helps him, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the products in the market. They already have had the business more than five years and it is going well.  

Now they want to expand the business further. Mousumi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy more fertilizers and seeds for more farming.  She says this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands. This improvement in the business will supply an additional profit, with which Mousumi wants to fulfill her goals.  She wants to give financial security to her family and provide better education to her daughters.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and other agricultural inputs for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 30 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Esperanza is borrowing 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pig-fattening business.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 50-year-old housewife who lives in a remote village Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has a fundamental education, having studied untill grade 4. She is a mother of two grown sons who are engaged in small business. One of her sons is engaged in a carpentry business.

For the last few years, Maya's son Gobinda, age 28 years, has been a carpenter. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the local people who want to furnish their houses. He mainly makes wooden furniture like tables, chairs, benches, wardrobes, etc. He is hardworking, ambitious and determined to establish himself in this business, as he is the main breadwinner for the family.  

Maya's other son's income is inconsistent, so the total household expenses depend on this carpentry business. Maya's biggest challenge is the high cost of products, which makes it difficult to expand the business.

Maya came to know from her neighbors that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives business loans, so she took a loan from them to help her son to grow the business. She will purchase additional stock of carpentry materials such as wood, tools etc. She hopes this will enable him to generate more income to support the family financially. She wants to go ahead with the business for a secured future.

She gives her hearty thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials for her son's existing business.

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Dagvadorj, 29 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2011. His wife has the job of packer in a private firm. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Dagvadorj is requesting a loan of MNT 2,650,000 to buy fiberglass, foam, and hardwood floors for home renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his home.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Cecille earns more income from food vending.

Cecille is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 37 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a packer at an agricultural company since 2010. Her husband began to work as a security officer in early 2014. Their daughter goes to high school. 

Using her previous loan, Munkhtsetseg has repaired the house roof. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to make an extension to her house so that her family will live in a comfortable and spacious home. Also, heat won't be lost so easily and the house will save the energy efficiently.

loans.use: to make a house extension

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Manila, Philippines. She is a 43-year-old, single woman who manages her own variety store business. Her income from the business is helping with her everyday needs and expenditures.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Marifel is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants to live a better life and she hopes to help her siblings complete their studies.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is married, with one child. She is 37 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City, Philippines.

To earn a living, Glenda sells basic commodities in a store and she has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 30,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, She hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to restock her general store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Jashoda

texts.en:
Jashoda is an energetic and diligent woman of 50 years from Maynaguri  She is married to Gajen, age 60 years. Jashoda is illiterate and can sign her name only. They have two sons. Both of their sons are engaged in vegetable business.

Jashoda 's husband is a farmer. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. But his income is scanty to cover all the expenses of the family. So to help her husband, Jashoda is also engaged in livestock breeding. A few years ago, she established a dairy business. She works seven days a week, five hours a day to support her family. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in rural India, especially in West Bengal. Cows are raised for their milk to make butter, curd and paneer (cottage cheese). In addition to producing milk, cows provide cow dung, which is used as fuel for fires and as good manure in agricultural lands. So raising cows is a profitable business.  

At present, Jashoda has two cows. She wants to increase the number of livestock, which can be possible through a loan, so Jashoda has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more cow to further extend her milk supply and milk products business. 

Jashoda plans to improve the economic condition of her family by the additional income and hopes to purchase an auto-rickshaw in future.

She thanks her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Blu-Ray to improve his room.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 63 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City, Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children.
     
To earn a living, Thelma has a business selling carenderia. She earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for carenderia. She has been a member of PMPC for 20 years. 

In the future, she would like to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for carenderia.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат трудолюбивая и сильная женщина. Она вдова и имеет 2 дочерей. Ее дочери совершеннолетние. Мухаббат имеет медицинское образование. Она работает медсестрой в больнице. Мухаббат пережила много трудности жизни. Ее муж умер рано от болезни. Мухаббат сама вырастила своих детей. Она дополнительно работала на поле и таким образом зарабатывала на жизнь. Мухаббат всегда старается, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Данное время ее дочь учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за ее учебный договор. С такой целью она запрашивает займ. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a strong and hard-working woman.  She is a widow with two grown daughters.  She was trained in medicine and works as a nurse in a hospital.  Muhabbat has lived through many struggles in her life.  Her husband died of an illness at a young age and she was left to raise her two daughters on her own.  She took on extra work in her field and was able to meet her needs that way.  Muhabbat has always worked hard to make sure her children get a good education.  Her daughter is now studying at university and Muhabbat needs to pay for her tuition.  With that goal in mind, she is asking for a loan.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Doris Clarivel

texts.es:
Doris Clarivel tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos que vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas y cerdos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Doris Clarivel is 42 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her family in the District of Oyotún, located in Chiclayo Province which belongs to Lambayeque Region, on the North Coast of Peru. It's people work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

She raises and sells animals like ducks, chickens and pigs. She has done this for a number of years. Her business is located behind her house. She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of animals and in this way generate greater revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 34 years old and lives in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a housewife. Her family consists of three children (one son and two daughters). Rita has not completed her secondary education and her husband studied up to primary level. They are providing education to all their children. One is in college and the other two are in different grades of secondary school. They live in their own kachha house (made of wood, straw and mud).

Rita's husband is a cycle-van puller. It is a kind of transport that is widely used in rural regions of India, especially in West Bengal, to carry loads and people. He earns money by pulling the cycle-van and somehow manages the household expenses. But the cycle-van is an old one and got damaged in a recent accident. As a result, the income has stopped. He is the only earning member for the family, so they are in an acute financial crisis. They thought it over and have decided to purchase a new cycle-van, but they don't have the capital.

Rita heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives financial assistance to rural woman and she took a loan to purchase a new cycle-van. This will allow her husband to carry on earning more income to strengthen their family's economy. She wants to buy more cycle-vans to expand the business and improve their present financial condition and to give higher education to her children.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medication, undergo exams and pay to see the doctor.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира мама троих детей и верная супруга. Ее муж работает за рубежом. Дети живут с ней. Нодира домохозяйка. В течение трех лет Нодира дома занимается земледелием, на огороде сажает овощи. Такой вид деятельности ей нравится. Нодира в этом году тоже посеяла овощи и теперь их надо обработать минеральными удобрениями. К сожалению, ней не хватает определенной сумму денег для реализации покупки. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Nodira is the mother of three children and a faithful wife. Her husband is working abroad. The children live with her. Nodira is a homemaker. Over the course of three years, Nodira has been engaged in agriculture at home, planting vegetables in the garden. She likes this type of activity. Nodira also planted vegetables this year and now they need to be treated with mineral fertilizers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to complete the purchase. For this purpose, she requested a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Эту 28-летнюю женщину зовут Садбарг. Она воспитывает четверых детей. Ее дочерям по 6 и 9 лет, а сыновьям по 5 и 8 лет. Садбарг у себя в городе Куляб занимается торговым бизнесом. На протяжении 6 лет она ведет торговлю на своей торговой точке, расположенной на местном рынке города. Она в основном занимается продажей бижутерии, заколок, резинок и других всяких принадлежностей для девушек. Садбарг вежливая, доброжелательная и целеустремленная. Она берет кредит, чтобы привезти новый ассортимент товара и хочет таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Только с вашей поддержкой она сможет реализовать свою цель.
texts.en: This 28-year-old woman's name is Sadbarg. She is raising four children. Her daughters are 6 and 9 years old, and her sons are 5 and 8. Sadbarg works in trade in the town of Kulob, For more than six years, she has sold from her stall at the town market. She mostly sells jewelry, hair clips, hair bands and other accessories for girls. Sadbarg is polite, friendly and purposeful. She is taking out a loan to bring in a variety of new products and thus attract more customers. Only with your support will she be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: buy an assortment of jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa y adicional a eso también siembra maíz y maicillo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor, para tener junto a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The client is 28 years old and lives in a rented house with her life companion. She sells clothing going door-to-door in the various neighborhoods close to where she lives. Besides this she also grows corn and sorghum. With what she earns she pays some of the household expenses. The client is requesting a loan to buy clothing wholesale so as to enjoy a better economic stability along with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru:
Гульгунча вежливая, добрая и милая продавщица на рынке городка Куляб. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Гульгунча живет вместе с детьми, их у нее четверо. Две дочки и два сына. 
   6 лет назад, Гульгунча начала новую деятельность в сфере торговли. Она арендует место на рынке и занимается продажей фруктов. Так появился хороший источник дохода. Гульгунчу хочет привести больше товара и новые виды фруктов на продажу, но чтобы осуществить задуманное ей не хватает $2000 и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Поддержите Гульгунчу.
texts.en:
Gulguncha is a polite, kind and sweet saleswoman in the city market of Kulyab. She is 38 years old. She is married. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Gulguncha lives with her chldren, of which there are four: two daughters and two sons.

Six years ago, Gulguncha began a new activity in the sphere of trade. She rents a space in the market and sells fruit. Thus appeared a good source of income and Gulguncha wants to bring more goods and new kinds of fruit for sale, but in order to get it right she lacks $2,000 and decided to request a loan.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of fruits for sale

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар родилась в 1957 году. Она замужем. Ее муж бухгалтер. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Мунаввар более 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Мунаввар в основном откармливает крупно-рогатого скота. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Данное время ее дочь больна и Мунаввар должна купить лекарства для ее лечения. Однако она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Munavvar was born in 1957. She is married. Her husband is an accountant. She is a very hardworking woman. For more than ten years, Munavvar has been raising livestock. Munavvar mainly fattens cattle. She buys cattle, fattens them for several months and sells them at the local market. Her husband helps her in conducting the business.

At the moment, her daughter is ill and Munavvar must purchase medicine to treat her. However, she does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine to treat her daughter

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a very young woman of only 23 years. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small village Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to grade 8 and got married at a tender age due to her parents' poor economic resources. Her husband, Apu, is a farmer of 27 years, who has received a higher secondary education. They are blessed with two small sons: one is a student in grade 3 and the other is too young for school. They have a small kachha house made of straw, bamboo and mud.

Kalpana's husband has been involved in vegetable farming for a long time. As he has no land of his own, he leased some land and started vegetable cultivation on a small scale. He started with a limited supply of vegetables, such as tomatoes, potatoes, beans, etc. He has developed a very good relationship with his customers as he sells fresh and high quality vegetables. Now he has a new idea of doing paddy cultivation, for which he needs capital.

So, Kalpana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). The loan will help her purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes to get a good profit from this new business to reach her goals of strengthening the family economy and educating her sons properly so that they can get ahead in life.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru:
Рухшона доброжелательная, добрая, трудолюбивая  и любимая жена. Она мать троих детей. Рухшоне 35 лет. У нее в браке имеется двое сыновей и дочка. Дочке 9 лет, сыновьям 8 и 4 года. Муж Рухшоны работает в Российской Федерации. Он был вынужден уехать, чтобы прокормить семью. Муж не забывает семью и помогает им. 
   Рухшона сама около 10 лет занимается продажей разной одежды. У нее есть не большое место для продажи, где продает шарфы, платки, детскую одежду, нижнее женское белье и т.д. Рухшона надеется получить кредит и привести новый товар и с большим ассортиментом, чтобы увеличить доходность, но у нее не хватает не большой суммы денег. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку и верит, что сможет реализовать задуманное.
texts.en:
Rukhshona is friendly, kind, hardworking, and a beloved wife. She is the mother of three children. Rukhshona is 35 years old. She is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is 9 years old  and her sons are 8 and 4 years old. Rukhshona's husband works in the Russian Federation. He was forced to leave in order to feed the family. Her husband has not forgotten about his family, and he helps them. 

Rukhshona has been selling clothes for ten years. She has a small shop where she sells scarves, shawls, children's clothing, lingerie, etc. Rukhshona hopes to get a loan and bring in new goods to increase her sales. However, she is short a bit of money. She is looking forward to your support and believes that she can follow through with her plans.

loans.use: buy new inventory including scarves, underwear, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son frescos y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Juan está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pescado por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 3 children. For several years he has made a living selling fish. His business is based in his home and he has a lot of customers because his produce is fresh and affordable. He is able to cover his household expenses with the profits he makes.

Juan is asking for this loan to buy fish wholesale so he can continue with his business and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат предпринимательница из северного города Худжанд. Она занимается продажей обуви, мужских шорт и брюк. В этой сфере деятельности она около 10 лет. Мухаббат любит свою работу и старается продвигать ее. В работе помогает ее дочь. Мухаббат вдова и живет с двумя детьми. Ей 44 года. Мухаббат надеется получить кредит и привести больше товара и увеличить ассортимент продукции с целью увеличения дохода, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is an entrepreneur from the northern city of Khujand. She sells shoes, men's shorts and pants. She has been in this sphere of work for about ten years. Muhabbat loves her work and strives to promote it. In her work, she is helped by her daughter. Muhabbat is a widow and lives with two children. She is 44 years old.

Muhabbat needs to receive a loan to bring more goods and to expand the assortment of products with the aim of increasing profits, in order to improve the financial position of the family.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of products

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 45-year-old housewife from Maynaguri.  Her family consists of her husband, Binod, and two grown-up sons.  They live in a small village, Tekatuli. Both Anna and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Their sons are deprived of education due to their poverty.  Now they work as laborers on daily wages.

Anna's husband is engaged in a small business of supplying food items.  He buys different snack items from wholesale markets and supplies local shops.  He and his sons have no consistent income.  So it is hardly possible for them to bear all the household costs of a family of four members.

Now, Anna wants to start a business selling puffed rice to help the family financially.  It is a very common and popular snack in India. It is made by heating sand in a pot and then throwing grains of rice into the heated sand.  The rice puffs up and is separated from the sand with a strainer.  Puffed rice is used on a wide variety of secular and religious occasions or even just to munch plain.

Anna has taken out a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase required ingredients for her puffed rice business.  She hopes it will enable her to fulfill the demand of the local market, and she will earn more profit through this business to cope with the growing expenses of her family.  She has an aspiration to enlarge her business in order to strengthen the family economy and have a secure future for her family.

Anna thanks BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To start a business of puffed rice.

loans.name: Mabelita

texts.es:
Mabelita tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente vive en el caserío de Laynas una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morrropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja, algarrobina, actividad que realiza hace más de 02 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la preparación de chicha de jora, bebida hecha a base de maíz y que es muy consumida en la parte norte del Perú.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo que le permita preparar mayor cantidad de chicha y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mabelita is 43 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in the village of Laynas in a rural area of the district of La Matanza, located in Morropon Province, which belongs to the Piura Region on the North Coast of Peru. It is a hot climate where the people work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Mabelita has been working selling honey and algarobbina (syrup made from the black carob tree) for more than 2 years. She also makes chica (corn beer) made from corn and is consumed a lot in the north of Peru.

Mabelita has requested a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy yellow corn to prepare a large quantity of chicha and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn to prepare a greater quantity of chica.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive en el Distrito de La Matanza , es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de agregados (piedra, arena, arenilla), actividad que realiza hace un año, contando con clientela fija que se dedican a la construcción de viviendas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de arena al por mayor para vender a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ronald is 44 years old and is single. He lives in the district of La Matanza, situated in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. Here the locals make their living from agriculture, livestock and commerce. He has basic services such as water and electricity.

Ronald makes a living selling aggregates (stones, sand and grit). He has been doing this for a year and has regular customers who work in housebuilding.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a larger quantity of sand wholesale to sell to his customers so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of sand to sell to his customers at a higher price.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Она жительница городка Куляб. Куляб маленький город, где живут дружелюбные, гостеприимные и доброжелательные жители. И одна из них Гулбахор. Ей 42 года. Гулбахор развелась с мужем и воспитанием детей занялась сама. У нее четверо детей. Старшему сыну 23 года, он находится за рубежом на заработках. Второму сыну 22 года, он учится в Университете в столице. Дочерям 17 и 16 лет. Они учатся в местной школе. 
  Полтора года назад Гулбахор начала для себя новую деятельность. Она научилась шить и начала брать заказы на шитье. И посей день, она занимается этой работой. Большую часть времени Гулбахор проводит со швейной машинкой. К сожалению, швейная машинка совсем устарела, и Гулбахор надеется купить новую, но из-за того что у нее не хватает суммы денег она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a resident of the town of Kulob. Kulob is a small town where friendly, hospitable and kind people live. One of them is Gulbahor. She is 42. Gulbahor divorced her husband and raised her children herself. She has four children. Her eldest son is 23 years old; he is working abroad. Her second son is 22 years old. He is studying at the university in the capital. Her daughters are 17 and 16 years old. They go to a local school. 

Eighteen months ago Gulbahor started a new business. She learned to sew and started taking orders for sewing. Now she  does this work. Gulbahor spends most of her time with a sewing machine. Unfortunately, her sewing machine is quite outdated and Gulbahor hopes to buy new, but because she does not have enough money, she applied for a loan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José Andrés tiene 56 años de edad y vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su conviviente en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a realizar trabajos de electricidad, a los moradores de su distrito que lo requieran, así como a las Instituciones que lo requiera, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para la misma.
texts.en:
José Andrés is 56 years old and lives with his partner in his own house built of rustic materials. He lives in the district of Colasay, situated in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

José Andrés works as an electrician for local residents and businesses wherever his services are required.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy construction materials for his home so he can generate more income for his household.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for some home improvements.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 53 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Regina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from boarding house renting and selling vegetables.

Regina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Mercy is 19 years old and is the 3rd of four children in the family. Her mother, Charlie, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines. Mercy is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree and is currently in the 1st year of this 4-year course. She is borrowing 4,000 PHP to pay tuition fees of the 1st semester (2014-2015). When she graduates, Mercy plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio has been farming for many years, even since before he got married. This is work that he had learned from his father. He produces fruit trees like mango in Misamis Occidental. He sells this farm produce in bulk and gets a higher income to support his family. Eusebio successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used to add capital to his business. 

He finds ways to continue his business for he gets a percentage-based commission given to small farmers who can't afford to finance the said production. Recently, he took a new loan for additional capital and to buy organic pesticides. He hopes to expand the business in order to improve the general living of the entire family as well as the farmers who became his business partners.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticides.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of buying and selling pro-biotic diary products (yakult) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of yakult products to sell. Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of yakult products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years. 

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid off 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en: Prescilla works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like net, gasoline, etc. She has been in this business for 32 years now. In the future, Prescilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Manila, Philippines. She is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Arthur, her husband, works as a welder. They manage a welding shop and their income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. Aside from this, Purita also operates her food vending business as her additional source of income.

Welding is a fabrication or sculptural process that joins materials, usually metals or thermoplastics, by causing coalescence. This is often done by melting the work pieces and adding a filler material to form a pool of molten material (the weld pool) that cools to become a strong joint, with pressure sometimes used in conjunction with heat, or by itself, to produce the weld. She also operates a vulcanizing business and offers electrical services as well. She earns a minimum of Php450 a day.
