To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more equipment for their business, and also items that are used to maintain their equipment. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business.

Purita dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to be able to save for other needs of her family and for future business expenditures. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional welding equipment and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She has a chicken-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and food vending. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of chicken to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food processing business in the Philippines. Conchita has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

She requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 37 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Rocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell.

Rocelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rocelyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and widowed, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Letecia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: José Neftali Atilio

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2º grado, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella y 2 estudian 1º y 3º grado, y con su pareja mantienen a sus hijos. 

El cliente desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y aprendió ya que le ayudaba a su padre; actualmente sembrara 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz a 3 cuadras de su hogar, ademas engorda cerdos y cuando pare la cerda vende los lechones. El crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas; comprara veneno y fertilizantes. Espera con la siembra tener buena cosecha para tener el ingreso para mantener a la familia y poder pagar la deuda contraída y en un futuro que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and studied as far as second grade. He has a partner and she looks after the home. They have three children living with them and two of them are at school, in 1st and 3rd grade. José and his partner provide for the children. 

From a very young age he has worked in agriculture and he learnt from his father while he was helping him. Currently he is growing 10,500 square metres of corn, three blocks away from his home. He also fattens pigs and when the sow gives birth he sells the suckling pigs.

The loan is to buy agricultural supplies. He plans to buy poison and fertilizers. He hopes to have a good harvest from this sowing so he can have enough income to support his family and pay off the loan. He also hopes his children turn out to be decent citizens.

loans.use: to buy poison and fertilizers, for cultivating 10,500 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Flor  Maria

texts.es:
La pulpería de Flor María es la más visitada de todo el barrio,  ya que en ella se encuentra desde condimentos, dulces, jugos, granos básicos hasta jabones de ropa, detergente y papel higiénico. Su local  cuenta con todo lo necesario para abastecer una vivienda, además la atención es inigualable. Siempre recibe a los clientes con amabilidad.
Las ventas aumentan cada día y las ganancias también. KIVA MiCrédito ha sido un apoyo esencial desde que inició este proyecto. Ellos  siempre le brindan el  capital  necesario para que su negocio se mantenga a flote. Flor recurrió a otro financiamiento con el propósito de  comprar granos básicos, jabones, artículos de aseo personal y gaseosas. Con los ingresos adquiridos continuará invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor María's convenience store is the most visited one in the entire neighbourhood, since there you can find everything from condiments, sweets, juices, and basic grains, to laundry detergents, other detergents, and toilet paper. Her shop has everything you need in your home, and her customer service is without equal. She always welcomes her clients in a friendly manner. 

Her sales and profits increase each day. Kiva's micro-loan has been an essential support since she started her business. Kiva lenders always provide her with the capital she needs to keep her business afloat. Flor has requested another loan in order to buy basic grains, soaps, toiletries, and soft drinks. With the income she earns, she will continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soaps, toiletries, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teresa Estela

texts.es:
Teresa de 40 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2º año de bachillerato, esta acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ellos y dos estudian 3º y 8º grado, y las personas que dependen de ella son sus hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos en la comunidad y decidió aprender el negocio por iniciativa propia, ademas es empleada la contratan para hacer las labores agrícolas del cultivo de la caña de azúcar, el horario es de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. 

Ella necesita el crédito para mejorar la vivienda, pues comprara bloques, cemento, arena, para levantar la pared, ya que donde vive es de lamina y cuando hay llena del rio se desborda y entra a su hogar. El sueño mas cercano es construir una casa mas apropiada para vivir, que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y con las ganancias de las ventas de zapatos invertir para dedicarse a vender ropa.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old and studied until the last year of high school. She has a partner who is a farmer, and they have three children who live with them, two of whom are in school, in the 3rd and 8th grade. Her children depend financially on her. For two years, she has been earning a living by selling shoes in the community. She decided to learn this business under her own initiative. She is also an employee who is contracted for farming labour in sugar cane fields, where the work schedule is from 6 am to 11 am. 

Teresa needs the loan to improve her home. She will buy cinder blocks, cement, and sand, since the place she lives is made of sheet metal and when the river overflows, the water enters her home. Her dreams are to build a house that is more appropriate for living, to have her children finish their studies, and to use the income from her shoe sales to invest in a business selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, and sand to put up a wall, as the place she lives is made of sheet metal and when the river floods, the water enters her home.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 52 years old and married, with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and coffee.

Eulalia has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and coffee.

loans.name: Carmen Cerela

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De  Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, dos mayores y tres de 13, 12 y 10 años, dos de ellos  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Carmen es una gran esposa y madre que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo  el cual tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, su esposo todos los días se desplaza a la ciudad de Portoviejo  a abastecerse de todos los productos en el mercado de mayoristas para luego trasladarse al mercado de su localidad y poder vender sus productos a las personas que a diario acuden a este lugar a comprar los alimentos. El lleva más  35 años  dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia de forma honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De  Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se siente útil al ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the Desarrollo Femenino communal bank meet every 15 days in the Calderón parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its delicious cuisine and rich vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants work in agricultural and general commerce.

Carmen, who is 45 years old, lives here. She is in a common-law marriage and has five children. Two of them are grown, and the other three are 13,12, and 10 years old. Two of them attend middle school, and the youngest one goes to elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.
Carmen is a great wife and mother. She is requesting the loan to help her husband. He has a business selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband goes to the city of Portoviejo every day to stock up on all the products in the wholesale market. He then  goes the market in his city and sells these products to the people who go there daily to buy food. He has been working in this occupation for over 35 years. This is how he supports his family in an honest way.

 This loan is to by fruits and vegetables for his business. She is a founding member of the communal bank. She likes it because of the loans. She feels useful upon helping her husband. Her dream is to have a food store at her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Pelemoni

texts.en:
Pelemoni is a 36-year-old, married woman, with four children. She runs a small fishing business with the help of her husband and brothers. She is now applying for her third loan and she works closely with her husband to sort out their finances for the week and to make sure that their essential everyday needs are met. 

With this loan, Pelemoni plans to purchase two fishing nets, a fishing canoe, and fishing lines for her fishing business. She has managed to provide a better living for her family with the profits she has been making from her business.

loans.use: to purchase two fishing nets, a fishing canoe, and fishing lines.

loans.name: Yeanet Laura

texts.es:
Yeanet es una joven emprendedora, tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su hijo, por quien lucha constantemente para poder brindarle un mejor futuro.
Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja en un restaurante como atención al público y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo muy respetuosa y amable con los clientes.
Yeanet está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la educación de su pequeño hijo y comprar los materiales que le sean solicitados en el colegio, así ella seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeanet, who is 26 years old, is an enterprising young woman. She is a single mother with one son and lives with her family in Nazca. Her son is her main motivation in life and she strives constantly to provide a better future for him. For over two years she has worked in a restaurant serving customers and it is going really well for her because she is responsible and hard-working and very friendly and polite to the customers. 

Yeanet is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the help they have given her will enable her to pay for her young son's education and buy the materials which have been requested by the school. By doing this she will be able to continue working hard to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her son's studies and buy materials requested by the school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Shylet

texts.en:
Shylet is twenty-eight years old and a mother of two living in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. Shylet has been successfully running a business of selling paraffin from her home over the past ten months. This makes her one of the main suppliers of floor polish producers in her community. 

To support the community’s wellbeing, Shylet volunteers as a life skills educator at the local secondary school. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she would like to make a bulk purchase of paraffin to improve her sales. This will enable her to sustain a stable income for her family.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of paraffin to improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bowls, umbrellas, and baskets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, paint, and locker doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, drinks and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing

loans.name: Beaular

texts.en: Beaular is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She has been operating a poultry project for over two years now, producing a batch of about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to one of the canteens at the local business center. She hopes to be a major supplier of chickens in her community one day. With the loan, Beaular will purchase stock feed, chicks and vaccines and even expand the fowl run. She will be able to further her education with the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Tabeth

texts.en:
Tabeth is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is currently living with her parents in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for 11 months now. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Tabeth will purchase grocery items such as cooking oil, soap, milk, flour, sugar and salt in bulk to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits she intends to own a supermarket and employ people from her community to assist her. 

Tabeth is also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She volunteers her spare time for this organization by assisting people who are physically challenged within her community with various tasks.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as cooking oil, soap, milk, flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Ruramai

texts.en:
Ruramai is a 27-year-old single mother of three living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for two years now. She started her business because she wanted to increase her income to better look after her children. 

When she is not working at her business, Ruramai serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member, volunteering to disseminate health information in schools and around her community. 

With the requested loan, Ruramai intends to make bulk purchases of groceries and boost her sales and profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment in her community and provide for her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is a 25-year-old mother of one, living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. For the past five months, she has been selling clothing from her home. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she can look after her family and become more financially stable. 

Cathrine spends her spare time volunteering as a Community Health Trainer, disseminating health information to schools and the community. With the requested Kiva loan, Cathrine intends to buy her clothing from wholesalers, allowing her to sell her products at more favorable prices and attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kimberly Jayne

texts.en:
Kimberly Jayne is a hard-working 17-year-old woman. 

She is studying in a university, taking BS Hotel and Restaurant Management. Her studies and ambition were dedicated to her siblings and parents who always support each other. Her previous loans from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) were used for her school tuition and other expenses.

Recently, Kimberly Jayne took a new loan to pay the school tuition, lab fees, and miscellaneous charges for the first semester of this school year. 

She wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition, lab fees, and miscellaneous charges.

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Llenar  un local con productos alimenticios no es tarea fácil. Sin embargo, Socorro del Carmen lo ha logrado gracias a su  disciplina, dedicación y esfuerzo.  En su pulpería ofrece los  productos básicos que todo hogar debe tener.  Las ventas aumentan cada día, porque diariamente son más las personas que la visitan. Las ganancias las utiliza para abastecer su negocio.
KIVA MiCrédito es un apoyo esencial para su negocio. La institución  le brinda el capital necesario cada vez que necesita abastecer su local. Socorro desea continuar este mismo ritmo de ventas, por lo que solicitó otro financiamiento para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, detergente y  confites, productos que cuentan con más demanda entre sus clientes. Su meta es continuar creciendo hasta convertirse en una mini distribuidora.
texts.en:
Filling a shop with groceries isn't an easy task. However, Socorro del Carmen has achieved this through self-discipline, commitment and hard work. In her grocery store she offers the everyday products that every home should have. Her sales are increasing each day, because she is getting more customers on a daily basis. She uses the profits to stock her business.

Kiva MiCrédito is an essential support for her business.  The institution provides her with the necessary capital each time she needs to stock her shop. Socorro wants to continue at this level of sales and this is why she has asked for another loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, detergent and sweets. These are all products which are in high demand from her customers. Her goal is to continue to grow until she becomes a mini distributor.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, detergent and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила — из Новой Каховки. Она торгует на местном рынке женской одеждой и трикотажем. В торговле проработала уже 22 года. Место торговое Людмила арендует у администрации рынка, своего пока нет. Товар у нее ходовой, есть своя база постоянных клиентов, на весь товар — доступные цены. 
Денежные средства в размере 33 500 гривен Людмила намерена потратить на пополнение летнего ассортимента одежды, а также на закупку товара уже и на осень: купить блузки, кофты, юбки, а также свитера, куртки и пальто.
texts.en: Ludmila is from New Kahovka.  She sells women's clothing and knitwear, and has worked in retail sales for 22 years.  Ludmila rents retail space at the local market, and does not yet have a space of her own.  She has a pool of regular customers and all of her goods are sold at fair prices.  Ludmila plans to spend 33,500 UAH to purchase summer and fall clothing, including blouses, cardigans, skirts, sweaters, jackets, and coats.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for sale

loans.name: Byakhar

texts.en:
Mr. Byakhar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He is renting a taxi from local Taxi company, and after 12 months he will own his taxi. 

He is a hardworking and loving family father. His wife teaches at the local church. 

In 2008, he owned a plot of land and built a house. Now, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to do the interior of their daughter's bedroom and entrance hall. 

If he repairs his daughter's bedroom and entrance hall, they will feel comfort at home.

loans.use: to repair his daughter's bedroom and entrance hall

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia raises pigs to sell, and has been in her business for fourteen years. She has been earning enough to provide for the needs of her family, and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for feeding supplies and her piggery's repair.  She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy piglets. She wants to have a better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her business.

loans.name: Katusha

texts.en:
Katusha lives in Yeghnik village of Aragatsotn region.

Katusha is a farmer who lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (her grandson is in the photo). To take care of her family’s needs Katusha is extensively engaged in agribusiness. With the help of her family members she is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding pigs, and in cultivation of wheat and greens. Katusha's husband takes the agricultural products to the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. As life is getting more expensive day by day, she wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to more effectively meet the needs of her family. A loan of USD 1,500 will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase eight calves, eight piglets and forage for the livestock. Katusha and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves, eight piglets and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Aida has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is engaged in her lavash (Armenian bread) production. Her business is going well and is enlarged after three years of hard work. Karine's bread production profit allowed her to cover her family's basic needs.

Karine says that it is too hard to be engaged in bread production and also take care of the household, but with her husband's help, she does her best in order to enlarge and increase her current business. 

This time Karine needs a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to make renovations to the bakery. Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovations to the bakery

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 47 years old and married, with four children. With four children in school, Sharon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Sharon has been in this business for three years. In the future, Sharon would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen and his family live in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Armen has a higher education and the specialty of historian. For many years he worked at the Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute Kapan branch as a lecturer of Armenian History and simultaneously at the Municipality Plans and Projections Division. Now Armen is the head of a Museum in Kapan city. He is married and he has a daughter who works as a guide and a son who is a marketer. Armen says that he likes his profession very much but he has an occupation which is like a hobby for him; that is farming and agriculture. In the village of Arajadzor he has a cute farm where he takes care of two cows and ten chickens. On his plot of land he has planted a nice orchard with apple pear, peach and plum trees. The main part of his farm harvest is used for their family and the other small part is only for sale. Armen is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder for his chickens and also diesel fuel to clean and make his nice orchard cuter.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his chickens and also diesel fuel to clean and make his nice orchard cuter

loans.name: Preng

texts.en: Preng has two cows, as seen in the photograph. Currently with one of them not producing milk due to its age and he wants to sell it. He wants to borrow 100,000 Albanian Lek to buy a young dairy cow of a good breed. This is why he is requesting this loan. Preng wants to thank you all for the financial help with the previous loans and wants to wish you a good summer.

loans.use: to buy one more cow;

loans.name: Lumnije

texts.en: Lumnije wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan, which she used to renovate her stable. Her financial situation has improved with her agricultural involvement and work as a babysitter. Lumnije is married again and her new husband currently working in a western country to support his family and send money to them. Lumnije wants to renovate her new house and is requesting a loan in order to change the doors and windows. This loan will help her to achieve her dream of having better living conditions for her family. She is grateful for the support and assistance that the lenders can give. She appreciate all of the lenders for the second support!

loans.use: To buy new doors and windows for her home.

loans.name: Rosna

texts.en:
Rosna is only 21 years old, married and a housewife from Maynaguri. She is married to Harishchndra, aged 21 years. Both attended school until grade 12 and were compelled to give up education due to poverty. They live in their own house at Haspatalpara in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have no children.

Rosna's husband runs a store where he sells small electrical goods such as bulbs, lights, wires, halogens, machines, blenders, etc. from the front of his house to earn an income to support his family. He also repairs electrical goods.  

Rosna is a housewife who helps her husband in his business. Rosna's husband is diligent, honest and for his polite behaviour, his customers like him. But his main obstacle is capital, because of which he can't expand his business and meet customer demand.

For this reason, Rosna has come forward to help her husband. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more electrical products to sell at her husband's store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of the customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

She is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase electrical goods to sell at her husband's store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien  trabaja como albañil y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y fríjol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL  para le compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client, age 27, lives in her own house.  She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and their three children.  She devotes herself to agriculture.  She grows corn and beans, and she sells them in the areas surrounding her zone.  With what she gets from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to cover the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan from Integral to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.  She will also use the loan to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph.  This way she and her family will be able to have better financial stability without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de zapatos, shorts, bóxer, faldas, blusas,  etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 45 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She works at clothing sales.  Because her business is located in a busy area, she  has many customers.  With her earnings from these sales and her husband's help, they can cover some of their home expenses.  

Maria is asking for a loan to buy shoes, shorts, underwear, skirts, blouses, etc., to earn more money and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shorts, underwear, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 32 years old and blessed with three children. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. Because of this, Jocelyn aims to improve her retail store to generate a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, frozen foods, and sanitary diapers to sell. She believes that, someday, she will further improve the business and make it more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, frozen foods, and sanitary diapers to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 34 years old and she has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for five years, and also earns an income from farming vegetables. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en: Lorry is 43 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Lorry has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 49 years old and married, with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, coffee, and chips.

Nancy has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, coffee, and chips.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is only 26 years old, energetic and optimistic. She is married and a mother of three school-going sons. She is married to Biswanth, aged 37 years, a farmer by profession. Both of them have primary education. They are providing education to all their children, who are in different grades in secondary level. They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud).

Anima's husband is engaged in agricultural activities. He grows vegetables, mainly potatoes, on his own land. He gives hard toil from dawn to dusk. Still he is unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to his family. 

Now Anima wants to help her husband. They thought it over and have decided to cultivate sugarcane, which is a profitable and much-demanded crop. It is widely cultivated in India, so, Anima has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase necessary agricultural inputs to start cultivation of sugarcane.  

She wants to work tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to spend on her children's education.

She wants to give her hearty thanks to her lenders for helping her by giving financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate sugarcane.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz María tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el Distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (patos y pavos), desde hace varios años, realiza esta actividad para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de pavos y gallinas así como para mejorar los corrales de crianza y compra de alimentos para las aves.

La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos para su familia, dado que el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio es una de las actividades principales como ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Cruz María, age 41, lives with her husband and her minor son in the Morropon district.  It is a community with a warm climate.  The population works in agriculture and commerce and with livestock.  It is located in the province with the same name in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been raising poultry (ducks and turkeys) for several years.  She engages in this business activity to help her husband with the family expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles to buy turkeys and hens.  She will also improve the coops where she raises them, and she will buy feed for the birds.

The investment will help her to get better income for her family.  This is because the market presents a good outlook.  The business is one of the main activities that serves as financial income.

loans.use: to buy small animals and to fix their pens.

loans.name: Merisyl

texts.en:
Merisyl is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her since she was able to buy more grocery products for her variety store. Her loan helped, not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting her everyday business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Merisyl would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 23,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merisyl dreams that her business will grow bigger and have more varieties of products. She hopes that her family is always in good condition. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc. Analyn has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Evelyn has been raising pigs for eight years, and also earns additional income from jeepney transport and a boarding house. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell. Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for 20 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para seguir prosperando junto con su negocio y tener materia prima para atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes, comprara cocos, bolsas y pajillas.
Juan ha logrado mantener funcionando su negocio e incorporo la venta de hielo, esto lo ha realizado gracias a la inversión del crédito anterior, vive en mejores circunstancias familiares y mantiene su buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to take out another loan in order to prosper with his business and to have the supplies to tend to his customers as best as he can. Juan will use this loan to buy coconuts, bags, and straws.

Juan has managed to keep his business going and has started selling ice. Juan was able to do this thanks to the investment of his previous loan. Juan is now living in better conditions with his family and has a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, bags, and straws.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is 36 years old. She is from Maynaguri. She lives with her husband, Madhab, and their only son in the village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both completed primary education, and could not continue further studies due to their poor economic condition. Their only son is a student of grade 7 in a local school.

Madhabi's husband is associated with agricultural activities. He cultivates different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Being a housewife, Madhabi manages all the household work and then assists her husband in the farming activities. Both of them give hard labor to take care of their farmland and to generate income.

Now they have decided to cultivate jute on their farmland, as it is a most useful and profitable crop. So, she thinks this will be a lucrative business because jute is in great demand. It is the high time to cultivate this crop, as it is a rainy season crop.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as early as possible.

She is much hopeful to earn a good profit from this new cultivation, which will help her to reach to her goals of leading a decent lifestyle, educate her son properly and purchase an auto-rickshaw to give it on rental for another means of income.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating jute on her farmland.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosas Del Sargento
Este dúo está formado por María Ángela originaria del caserío el sargento, ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como lo son: Pavos, Gallinas, Patos y Conejos, tienen la gran ventaja de vivir en una área que se presta para criar esta clase de animales. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita en el anterior pago puntualmente. Con el crédito ha podido comprar más pollos para crecerlos y luego venderlos ya más grandes, esto les está ayudando a cumplir sus sueños de tener un mejor ingreso para así ayudar a sus esposos en darle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar concentrado para aves, vitaminas y desparasitantés.
texts.en:
Duo, Rosas del Sargento (The Sergeant’s Roses) 

This duo is formed by Maria Angela, native of the small village of El Sargento.  She makes a living raising poultry such as: turkeys, chickens, ducks and rabbits. They have the great advantage of living in an area that lends itself to breeding these types of animals. 

This is the second loan she is requesting. She paid the previous one duly. With the loan she has been able to buy more chickens to grow them and then sell them when they are bigger. This is helping them accomplish their dream of having a better income, so that they can help their husbands provide the best for their young children. 

She is requesting the loan to buy vitamins, wormers, and poultry feed.

loans.use: to pay for vitamins, wormers, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Dúo San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Duo San Pablo

Este Dúo esta conformado por las socia Dina es originaria de San Andrés  itzapa Chimaltenango, tiene su negocio propio es una persona muy luchadora ya que también aporta en los gastos de la casa, dona Dina tiene una venta de regalos además de eso vende granizadas en la puerta de su casa,  todos los días se levanta temprano y aprovechar de las horas para poder tener mas ganancias, y necesita de un crédito para poder surtir mas sus negocio, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con kiva  y pormete pagar los pagos en cada fecha que se les asigne , además desde ya agradecen por la oportunidad de ser parte de kiva.
texts.en:
“San Pablo” Group
This group was started by Dina, who is originally from San Andrés Itzapa Chimaltenango.  She has her own business and is a very determined individual.  In addition, she is able to help with the household expenses.  Doña Dina has a gift shop, but she also sells snow cones from the doorstep of her house.  Every day she wakes up early and takes advantage of this time so that she can earn more income. 
She needs a loan so that she can acquire more stock for her business.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan through Kiva and she promises to submit her payments on each of the assigned dates.  In addition, she is grateful for this opportunity to be a part of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy gifts and supplies for making and selling snow cones.

loans.name: Dúo Deslumbrantes I Group

texts.es: El dúo Deslumbrantes l conformado por doña Edendida Cecilia quien posee un pequeño local ubicado en ciudad vieja, san miguel y tiene 3 hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas, regalos, ropa para caballeros, niños etc. Solicita su crédito para compra de pantalones para dama ya que es más solicitado por sus clientes en su localidad, ya que sus ingresos han logrado ayudarla a poder darles estudios a sus hijos y su deseo es poder brindarles estudios universitarios a sus 3 hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta
texts.en: The group "Dúo Deslumbrantes" includes Edendida Cecilia who owns a small shop located in Cuidad Vieja, San Miguel. She has three children. She works selling clothing for men, women, and children, and gifts, etc. She is applying for this loan to buy women's pants since those highly sought by the customers in her town. Her income has helped her provide an education for her three children and her dream is to be able to afford her three children with a university education. She is applying for this loan to buy new clothing for resale.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Lupita De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Dúo Lupita de San Miguel
Este dúo está formado por doña María Nieves ella tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa de dama caballero y niño así como ropa de bebe en su tienda, en su domicilio ubicado en San Miguel Milpas Altas, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de zapatos para dama, su deseo es surtir su miscelánea ya que tiene un pedido de zapatos típicos, y crecer más su tienda.
texts.en:
“Lupita de San Miguel” Group
This group includes Doña María Nieves, age 45.  She sells shoes and clothes for women, men, children, and babies from her variety store.  Her business is located in her home in San Miguel Milpas Altas. 
María Nieves is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of women’s shoes.  Her wish is to restock her variety store since she already has an order for traditional shoes.  This will help her grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gulbiby

texts.ru: Гулбиби вдова. Она воспитывает 1 дочь. Гулбиби вместе со своей дочерью живет в отдаленном регионе на Севере Таджикистана. Она занимается скотоводством уже более 5 лет. Гулбиби начала свой бизнес откармливанием 3 голов мелко-рогатого скота. Гулбиби постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она откармливает скот несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке. Гулбиби всегда старается, чтобы ее дочь получила хорошее образование.  Ее дочь студентка 1 курса и она должна оплатить за ее учебу. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbiby is a widow. She is raising a daughter. Gulbiby and her daughter live in a remote area in the north of Tajikistan. She has worked with livestock breeding for 5 years already. Gulbiby started her business with breeding three sheep and goats. Gulbiby developed her business step by step. She breeds livestock for a few months and sells them at the local market. 

Gulbiby always strives for her daughter to get a good education. Her daughter is a first year student and she needs to pay for her tuition. Gulbiby requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar to pay for her daughter's tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her daughter

loans.name: Avazbek

texts.ru: Авазбек с детства был трудолюбивым и честным человеком. Он родился и вырос в отдаленном регионе. Авазбек год назад начал свой бизнес производством и продажей лепешек. Он имеет свою пекарню у себя дома. Ее жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Авазбек и его жена воспитывают 2 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние. Авазбек старается обеспечить  свою семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Авазбек планирует развевать свой бизнес. Он должен для этого произвести больше лепешек. Авазбек запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов Сша для покупки муки, дров и т.д. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Avazbek has been hardworking and honest since his childhood. He was born and grew up in a remote region. Avazbek started his business of producing and selling flatbread a year ago. He has his own bakery at his home. His wife helps him manage the business. 

Avazbek and his wife are raising two children. The children are not yet adults. Avazbek strives to provide his family with all necessary facilities. He plans to expand his business. To do this he needs to produce more flatbread. 

Avazbek requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar to purchase flour, wood etc. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy flour, wood etc. for expanding his bakery business

loans.name: Cladys

texts.es:
Cladys tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en el Caserío La Bocana,una zona rural del distrito de Morropon es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja, algarrobina, desde hace 02 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cladys is 42 years old, and in a civil union.  She lives in  El Caserio, La Bocana, a rural area in Morropon district.  This is a place where people work at farming, cattle raising and trade.  The area has basic services such as water and electricity. Morropon is in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Cladys has been working at the sale of honey from bees and algarrobina (traditional fruit drink) for two years.   Her business is located in her home. She is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 PEN to buy a larger quantity of products to offer her customers and thus earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of products to offer to her customers

loans.name: Bertha Lida

texts.es:
Bertha Lida tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, actividad que realiza hace más de 01 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha Lida is 20 years old, of single marital status, and lives in the district of Buenos Aires. It is a place where the inhabitants work in agriculture, livestock, and trade, and has basic services such as running water and electricity. It is located in the Province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. 

She works raising and selling small animals, an activity which she has been doing for more than a year. She relies on a steady clientele. She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 soles for the purchase of feed for fattening her animals which will allow her to offer them at a better price to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo: Tiene 29 años de edad, casado. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la comercialización y distribución de mariscos con empresas exportadoras. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido comprar un taxi. Solicita financiamiento, para darle mantenimiento a su taxi: Llantas, lubricantes, aceite, liquido de freno. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer maricos al por mayor en otras empresas del país.
texts.en: Arturo is 29 years old and married. With the goal of having his own source of income, he began working four years ago in the commercialization and distribution of shellfish with exporter companies. Thanks to his profits and the loans awarded previously with PANA PANA, he was able to purchase a taxi. He is applying for a loan to perform maintenance on his taxi including tires, lubricants, oil, and brake fluid. His dream is to grow his business and offer wholesale shellfish to other companies in his country.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi: tires, lubricants, oil, and brake fluid.

loans.name: Elusinda

texts.es: Elusinda: Es una mujer amable y trabajadora, tiene 60 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo, mayor de edad, Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 4 años estableció  en su vivienda una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, jabones de lavar ropa, de lavar traste, de baño, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Elusinda is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is 60 years old and a single mother of one grown son. With the goal of having her own source of income, she established a small convenience store in her home four years ago. She is applying for a loan to buy merchandise including basic grains, dairy products, detergents, soaps to wash cooking utensils and bathrooms, and more. Her dream is to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including basic grains, dairy products, detergents, soap to wash clothing, dish soap, bathroom soap and other products.

loans.name: Espie

texts.en:
Espie is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming flowers in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Espie has been farming flowers for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Espie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 29 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Pacita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Pacita has been in this business for five years.  In the future Pacita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie is 35 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. Gerlie has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and rice. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. Charina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en: Palepa is a 40-year-old, single mother of three children. She sells ice pops and snacks to the children of her community and also to the public. She plans to use this money to purchase sacks of sugar, chinese lollies, cordials, plastic cups, snacks, noodles, and biscuits for her business. She buys these things in bulk from the wholesalers and she sells them out individually. Palepa has found that she makes a good profit from this kind of business, and she is managing well, taking care of her children and providing a better education for them. Therefore, she hopes to save more of her profits so that she would be able to continue to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, chinese lollies, cordials, plastic cups, snacks, noodles, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: La Florida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Florida está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo ciudad conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una geografía accidentada, cuenta con diferentes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente al igual que todas las socias aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, forma parte del grupo de crédito La Florida desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha estrechado aun más sus lasos de amistad, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque los créditos le ayudan a crecer en el negocio y también comparte gratos momentos con sus amigas del grupo.
La Señora María tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de comida actividad que la realiza desde su casa, se dedica a esta actividad de lunes a sábados desde hace 6 años. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar sillas y mesas. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The credit group La Florida is made up of 7 female members and 1 male member who live in the city of Cuenca, a city known as Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers, and since December 1999 has been a Cultural Heritage Site. It has a rugged terrain and has many places to enjoy nature. Its people, like all of the members, still maintain the culture and traditions of the towns, and are friendly, kind and hard working. 

One of the members of this group is a woman named Maria. She has formed a part of the credit group La Florida for the past two years, during which time she has even further strengthened ties of friendship. She likes this form of loans because the loans help her to grow her business and also to share great times with her friends in the group. 

Señora María is 54 years old. She is a single mother with three older children who are married and live on their own. She doesn't have her own house, so she rents.

Doña María makes a living selling food, work that she does out of her house. She has been doing this work from Monday to Saturday for the last 6 years. The money from this loan is to buy tables and chairs. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии, и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Рузигул замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Рузигул более 6 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу и картошку. Рузигул этим бизнесом занимается уже более 6 лет. Ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Она работает упорно, чтобы получить хороший урожай. Полученный урожай она продает на местном рынке. Рузигул запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This woman, who has a good soul, needs financial support, as her home is in a bad condition, and she urgently needs to renovate it. Ruzigul is married and raising four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. 

Ruzigul has worked with field crop cultivation for more than 6 years. Specifically she grows wheat, sweet corn and potatoes. She has had her own business for 6 years already. Her children help her manage the business. She works hard in order to get a good harvest. She sells the harvest she gets at the local market. 

Ruzigul requests a loan in the amount of 600 US dollar to purchase building materials such as cement, wood and so on. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for renovating her house

loans.name: John Alexander

texts.es:
John es un hombre de 22 años de edad el cual se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar puesto que es muy preocupado por ellos y de parte de él según dice John nunca les faltara comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como guarda y es la cría de cerdos con los que ha podido mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia, como persona cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio es por esta razón que requiere una crédito para la compra de marramos de engorde con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos que ofertar.
Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por ellos.
texts.en:
John is a 22 year old man who works as a security guard.  Since his income is not sufficient to cover the household expenses, he is worried about them.  John says that he doesn’t want anything to come up short so he started raising hogs during his spare time as a guard and this has allowed him to improve his family’s quality of life.  As the head of the household he is in charge of all the expenses and it doesn’t leave him much capital to invest into his business.  He needs a loan to buy piglets so he can improve his sales and make his business more attractive to his customers because he will have more pigs to offer.

His main dream is to be able to generate a good income so his family will want for nothing as he did and it affected him in a big way, so he works tirelessly for them.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусние 54 года. Она из города Душанбе. Хусния живет вместе с дочерью и ее мужем. Дочь домохозяйка, ее муж работает продавцом. Хусния сама работает на дому. Она является портнихой, берет заказы на шитье. Хусния научилась шить и кроить у мамы. Это умение она использует в жизни. Благодаря заказам у нее есть источник дохода. Хусния много лет трудилась со швейной машинкой, которое Вы видите на фотографии. Ее швейная машинка стала плохо работать и чтобы не тормозить работу и не лишиться источника дохода, Хусния решила купить новую швейную машинку. Но на новую машинку денег не хватает, и она надеется получить кредит.
texts.en: Husniya is 54 years old. She is from the city of Dushanbe. Husniya lives with her daughter and son-in-law. Her daughter is a homemaker, and her son-in-law works as a salesperson. Husniya works out of her home. She is a seamstress and takes orders for clothing. She has learned how to cut out fabric and sew from her mother. This is a skill that has come in handy in her life. Thanks to her sewing orders, she has  a source of income. Husniya has used the sewing machine you see in the photo for many years. Recently  the machine started malfunctioning, and in order to avoid slowing down her work and losing income, Husniya decided to buy a new sewing machine. She lacks the necessary cash and hopes to receive a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
Alma Nidia es originaria del municipio de El sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente del departamento de León donde ha vivido toda su vida, se casó y procreó dos hijas las cuales dependen de ella económicamente y una de ellas estudia en la actualidad.
Se desempeña como maestra de primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a esta profesión.
Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado con los créditos que le han financiado, ya que hoy su casa tiene mejores condiciones donde su familia vive dignamente.
En este momento Alma Nidia está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos, pago de consultas médicas, realización de exámenes, pago de transporte, ya que ha estado mal de salud y quiere mejorar para no estar faltando a su trabajo, ya que necesita mucho del trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Espera que estos inversionistas le sigan apoyando como a muchas familias de escasos recursos de Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia is originally from the municipality of El Sauce in the west of the León department of Nicaragua. Alma has lived there all of her life: she is married and has two daughters who depend on her financially; one of Alma's daughters is studying at university.

Alma is a primary school teacher at a local school; she has been practising this profession for over 20 years.

Alma is very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support provided through loans. As a result of these loans, Alma now enjoys a higher quality of life and lives a decent life with her family.

Alma is now applying for a loan to buy medicines and to pay for medical appointments, tests, and transport costs. She has been ill and wants to get better so that she does not miss work. She really needs her job in order to take home an income.

Alma hopes that Kiva investors continue to support many poor families in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy medicines and to pay for medical appointments, tests, and transport costs.

loans.name: Jo Roxan

texts.en:
Jo Roxan wants to become a successful IT specialist someday. He studies at university in order to achieve his ambition. He used his previous loan to pay for tuition fees. To continue his journey, he recently took a new loan to pay tuition fees for his summer class.

Jo Roxan is thankful to GDMPC as a part of his journey and hope it brings success to him.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his summer class.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Джурабек честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он вместе семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Джурабек женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его дети несовершеннолетние, а жена домохозяйка и поэтому Джурабек является единственным кормильцем семьи. Он работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Джурабек мастер по производству колыбели. Он производит национальные колыбели новорожденных «гавхора».  Джурабек этим ремеслом занимается уже более 20 лет. Его ремесло является источником его семейного дохода. Джурабек запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки древесина. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jurabek is an honest and hardworking man. He lives in a remote region together with his family. Jurabek is married and raising three children. His children are not yet adults, and his wife is a housewife. Jurabek is the only breadwinner in the family. He works hard from early morning to late evening. 

Jurabek is a master manufacturer of cradles. He produces Tajik national cradles for newborns, called "gavhora". Jurabek has worked with this craft for more than 20 years already. His craft is the family's source of income. Jurabek requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni to purchase wood. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wood for manufacturing cradles

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina, 51 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She and her husband manage a food stall in their village, from which they cater daily cooked meals. She's been in this business for almost seven years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 daily. Her net income usually is spent on their hog raising and agricultural business. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 35,000 to purchase food ingredients for her food vending business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will able to improve her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Friendwel

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Friendwel has the determination to become successful in the future. He is 30 years old and single. He lives with his parents in a rural community and earns a living through farming. To have additional income, he engages in raising hogs to sell. He aims to acquire more pigs to raise, but he has insufficient capital. With this regard, Friendwel is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more pigs to raise, hog feeds, and vaccines and vitamins needed for his hogs. He is hoping that his requested loan will help to make improvements in his business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise, hog feeds, and vaccines and vitamins needed for his hogs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice has been running a retail store in order to provide for the needs of her two children. She sells assorted groceries in her village to make a living. Her husband helps her in operating her business. 

To improve sales, Janice took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to re-sell. In the future, Janice wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Yari Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yari del Rosario tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar edad vive en casa familiar junto a su cónyuge en el caserío distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, comida, cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, en la parte posterior tiene un corral donde se dedica a la crianza de animales menores que le permiten generar ingresos adicionales, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para arreglos de su vivienda y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yari del Rosario is 29 years old and has a partner. She has two school-aged children. Yari lives with her partner in the La Matanza district of the Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. Here in La Matanza, people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Yari herself makes a living selling "chicha de jora" (a tradition corn liquor), as well as food and beer. She runs the business out of her home. Yari also has a pen at the rear of her house where she raises young animals, allowing her to earn a little extra money. Yari has applied for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in order to buy building materials to make improvements to her house. With this loan, Yaro will generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make improvements in her home.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en el Distrito de La Matanza, la vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que no existe peligro alguno, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales como actividad económica principal, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, comida, cerveza, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos como cerveza y maíz para preparar la chicha de jora y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teodora is 29 years old, single and lives in La Matanza districty, of the Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. Teodora lives a quiet life as there are no dangers here. The people in La Matanza mainly make a living in farming, cattle-raising, and breeding other animals.

Teodora herself makes a living selling "chicha de jora" (a traditional corn liquor), food, and beer. She has been doing this work for four years, and also makes a living raising young animals at the rear of her house. Teodora has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy products such as beer and corn for preparing "chicha de jora". With this loan Teodora will be able to generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beer and yellow corn for preparing "chicha de jora".

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi is a young, cheerful and hardworking woman only 20 years old from Maynaguri. She is married. She lives with her husband in the small village of Anandanagar, a rural area in Jalpaiguri district. Both of them are uneducated and can only sign their names. They did not have the opportunity to study due to financial difficulties in their families.

Tulsi is a homemaker and takes care of the household and her husband.  Her husband Sanjay is engaged in a small business. The earnings from his business are so scant that it is hardly enough to bear their food expenses.  Tulsi is not such a lady to sit idly, waiting for her husband's income. She has a business so that she can also earn money for the family. She runs an animal husbandry business. She sells cow's milk and cow dung.  Her milk supply business is very profitable and she has achieved a good many customers through her hard work and dedication.  Her neighbors are her main clients.  At present,  she has two cows and a few goats in her herd.  She currently wants to acquire more cattle and expand her business. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase one dairy cow.  She hopes very much for a positive outcome, which will help her to reach to her goals such as providing a better education and living for her children in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Maria Rowillyn

texts.en: Maria Rowillyn studies Business Administration in the university. She lives in Oroquieta City with her family. She has three siblings and she wants to make them happy after she gains success in the future. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to pay the first semester tuition fees. Her future dreams are to finish her studies and to have a stable job.

loans.use: to pay the first semester tuition fees.

loans.name: Warren

texts.en: Warren is 26 years of age, married and has one child. He is raising his family in a rural community and makes their living through farming. He also engages in the hog-raising business to have additional income. Despite hardships, he has the determination to uplift the living status of his family. He planned to strengthen his business but he doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, he wants to avail himself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. Being a hard working father, Warren believes that he will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
