Susana is a 58-year-old widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Susana runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for four years. 

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Airah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Airah works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Airah is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Airah has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and is married with five children, one of whom is in school. Yolanda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal, and has been in this business for ten years. 

Yolanda has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi is from Maynaguri.  At the age of only 19, she is married and a mother of a young daughter.  She is married to Rabi, aged 23.  They have a primary education but they could not continue further study due to the poor economic resources of their families. Their daughter is too young for school. They live in the village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (house made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Tulsi's husband has a business selling 'PHHUCHKA' (panipuri) . It is a kind of snack that is very popular in India, especially in West Bengal.  Unfortunately, the meager income from the business is hardly sufficient to run the family well.  Tulsi is young, energetic and active.  She wants to get ahead in life.  In order to make money to support the family, Tulsi runs an animal husbandry business. She sells the cow milk to her neighbors and earns for the family.  In spite of the hard labor of both Tulsi and her husband, their financial condition is not stable. At present, Tulsi has only one cow, but she wants to purchase one more cow to improve her business.

With this aim, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She hopes she will sell more milk and earn more profit. She plans to give her family a decent and better quality of life and her daughter a good education.

She thanks both of her lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Giosita

texts.en:
Giosita owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns a maximum amount from this activities to provide for the needs of her family. 

Giosita has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for the business.To improve her business, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy grocery goods to sell in addition to her charcoal vending. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tultuli

texts.en:
Tultuli is a very young and enthusiastic woman of only 30 years, who hails from Maynaguri  in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Tapan, age 30, and together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter). She studied up to grade six and could not continue further due to her parents' poor economic resources, but her husband is uneducated. He can only sign his name. But they are providing an education to their children who are in grade seven and grade two.

Tultuli's husband is a small trader of food items who buys snacks (noodles, biscuits, puffed rice cakes etc.) from the wholesale markets and supplies the local shops.  It enables him to take care of his family with difficulty.  In order to help her husband, Tultuli also does farming.  She has an animal husbandry business with one dairy cow and a few goats. She sells milk to her neighbors and earns for her family. Tultuli gets satisfaction from raising dairy cows because the milk brings in a good income. Her biggest challenge is increasing the family income. So, she wants to expand her business by purchasing another cow.

Tultuli chose BJS (Kiva’s partner) for this loan because it caters to the interests of small-scale businessmen.  The loan will enable her to add more cows for milk production and thus generate more income.  She has a dream of having a cattle herd. She wants to use the profit to educate her children better and improve her family's living standards.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 42-years-old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Hilda has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Hilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now. 

Paz has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se desempeña como maestro de construcción civil, cuenta con diversos contratos tanto por moradores de su distrito y las Instituciones que requieren de su servicio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento y ladrillo para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in the district of Colasay: a community known for its agriculture and cattle industry. It is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of northern Peru.

He makes a living teaching industrial construction; he has several contracts through local residents and institutions requiring his service. He has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy bricks and mortar to offer to sell to customers, and thus generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks and mortar to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of clothes and items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and with their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 43,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of clothes and items needed in her business. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Naima dreams to have her own stall in a place where her products can be easily seen. She hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of clothes and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. Annie has been in this business for two years now. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Annie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a 30-year-old female. She is divorced with three children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She ensures that her children's welfare is maintained from the small savings she gets from cocoa selling. 

Sauda has struggled to get a vegetable stall in the market and increase her income to meet her daily expenditure ever since she divorced. Although she is hardworking, transport and poor income generation due to seasonal changes affect her progress.

Sauda is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa  to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of thirteen children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alicia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, canned goods, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant, like vegetables, meat, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 56 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Meriam has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, is aged 38, married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily when she sells vegetables. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances for their children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase bitter gourd, eggplant, squash, and string bean seedlings. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business more and she hopes to grow it continuously.

loans.use: To purchase bitter gourd, eggplant, squash, and string bean seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and gasoline.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. Ritchel is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ritchel has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is 53 years old, married, a housewife and a mother of four grown-up sons.  Two of her sons are students. One is in grade 10, the other is studying at the I.T.I (Industrial Training Institute).  Both Shefali and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in the small village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shefali's husband Ganesh, age 57, is a farmer by profession.  He grows vegetables and fruits like potatoes, beans, cucumbers, carrots etc. on his farmland. His earnings, however, can't give sufficient financial sustenance to maintain all the expenses of a family of six members. Shefali is a very energetic and optimistic lady. She is motivated to provide her family with good quantity food, health and education.

She has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a stone-cutting machine. She has decided to start a business supplying stones to building contractors.  These kinds of stones are used in making buildings in rural areas. She and her husband have chosen this business, as it is a lucrative business now-a-days.

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members, especially giving better education to her sons.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a stone-cutting machine for starting a business supplying stones to building contractors.

loans.name: Shukashwari

texts.en:
Shukashwari is a rural woman of 45 years from Maynaguri, who lives with her husband Ramesh, age 49, and their only son. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer by profession. Both are uneducated and can only sign their names. They were deprived of an education due to the poor financial resources of their family. Their son reads in grade four. They live in Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district in their own house.

Her husband is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where he grows potatoes, beans and eggplants.  He is a very hardworking person who does his best to insure a good harvest. He sells his agricultural products to the local markets.  He is a very polite and well-behaved person.  So his customers like him. But he can't grow a variety of vegetables and satisfy his customers due to the lack of capital.

Shukashswari is involved in animal breeding to help her husband.  For the last five years, she has been supplying milk to her neighbors to earn an income for her family.  Yet they are unable to fulfill the family's needs.  She has only one cow in her herd. So she has decided to purchase one more and that's why she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). When the cow is purchased, she will be able to expand her business of selling milk. This will increase the family income and Shukashwari hopes to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

She aspires to provide her son with a better education in a better school.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for starting a milk supply business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 60 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Ma. Silang

texts.en:
Ma. Silang is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming fruit trees in the Philippines. Ma. Silang has been farming fruit trees for 20 years. She also earns additional income from buying and reselling charcoal.

Ma. Silang is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.en:
Ana Vilma works hard to support her family. Ana Vilma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

Ana Vilma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ana Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 32-year-old male and married with four children.  He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When Jamil earned a small savings from his restaurant, which has been in operation since 2007, he decided to buy a motorcycle to increase his household income. He hopes to have many motorcycles for his transportation business; however, he is challenged by changes in weather and poor roads that cause constant mechanical break downs.

He intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Kimatoy

texts.ru: Киматой целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она из сельской местности. Киматою 41 года. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Киматой после окончания средней школы вышла замуж и не продолжила учебу. Таким образом,  она осталась без высшего образования. Киматой более 20 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает овощи и зерно.  Она продает полученный урожай на местном рынке. Несколько месяцев назад ее муж приехал с России и теперь он помогает ей введению бизнеса. Киматой хочет сделать второй посев, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kimatoy is a hardworking woman who strives to achieve her goals. She is from a rural area and is 41 years old. She is also married and has five children. She got married after finishing high school and did not continue her studies, so she does not have a college education. Kimatoy has planted crops for over 20 years, mainly vegetables and grains. She sells her crops at the local market. A few months ago her husband came back from Russia and now he helps her with the business. Kimatoy wants to plant for a second harvest but does not have the money to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is requesting a loan to buy these things and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina has been working in her own beauty parlor for many years to make a living. With the generated income from her services, she was able to sustain the family's needs. 

Planning to improve the business, she recently took a new loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. 

Lina hopes to increase her income so she can take care of her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Perlas

texts.en:
Perlas is 53 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Perlas has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Haza

texts.en:
Haza, a twenty-year-old married man with three children, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

When Haza realized that cocoa farming was not contributing much to his household income, he decided to start up a retail shop using the long time savings from his cocoa selling. 

Like any other business, he is faced with hardships of low sales and returns because of price fluctuations in the market. He dreams of having a wholesale shop. 

He is a hardworking person who wants a loan to buy torches, male pants, and sweets for selling.

loans.use: to buy torches, male pants, and sweets for selling.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a fifty-six-year-old male married with ten children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. John depends on coffee and cocoa growing to maintain his big family's cost of living, especially settling school fees for his children, when harvests are made and sold to cocoa companies in the area. He wishes to build a permanent residential house and educate his children to higher levels of education. His setback is the unpredictable weather changes. He is a hardworking man who will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel earns better income from his agricultural field of business. With his income, he was able to successfully repay his previous loan used for farming. 

In addition to this, he also used the capital for his retail business selling grocery goods in his village. 

To improve sales, Manuel took  a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Manuel wants to have a reserve fund for future emergencies and hopes for business expansion one day.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

Rona has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Jose Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel Jesús tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casado con 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Jesús is 48 years old, of married marital status and with 2 children. He lives with his family in the Oyotún District, a rural area that is dedicated to agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the Chicalyo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the north coast of Peru. 

He makes a living, for several years now, selling groceries, such as: rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and beans. His store is located in his home. 

He has requested a loan of 2000 Nuevos soles, from Edpyme Alternativa, to purchase a greater amount of goods to supply his business and that way generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase goods to supply his business.

loans.name: Teofilo Adrian

texts.es:
Teófilo Adrian tiene 22 años de edad, vive en su casa propia de material rustico, junto con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de 3 y 08 meses, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, ubicado con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para utilizarlo en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha.

De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
22-year-old Teófilo Adrian lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife and their two young children, one aged 3 years and one aged 8 months. He lives in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The area has a hot climate and the locals make a living in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Teófilo Adrian works in agriculture, specifically in growing corn and has 4 years' experience in this. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to use for agricultural labour, for applying pesticides and fertilizers, and labour for the harvest.

This will help to improve the plant physiology and productivity of his crop and help produce a good harvest, and as a result he will get a better yield and a better quality product and so will not have any problems selling the harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure for his corn crop and pay for day labourers to look after the crop.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros, en un corral que tiene en la parte posterior de su domicilio, también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros por zonas aledañas a su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de borregos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is 37 years old. He lives with his partner and their 2 children in the district of Cayaltí, situated in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Víctor makes a living raising and selling rams, in a pen at the back of his home. He also provides a public transport service with his mototaxi, transporting passengers from neighbouring areas.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a larger number of sheep to sell to his customers so he can make more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of sheep to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lourdes  Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora. Lourdes se encuentra en su cuarto crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Pucacruz, este grupo es unido y siempre se apoyan para salir adelante, los créditos le ayudan a mejorar su negocio. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural ya que se encuentra en lo más alto de una montaña y desde allí se observa los paisajes, su gente se dedica a las tareas del campo como la crianza de animales,  a la agricultura y muchos salen a diario a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. 
La Señora. Lourdes tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, está muy emocionada ya que está embarazada de su tercer hijo. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
Doña Lourdes se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para ayudarle a su esposo económicamente cría ganado, cerdos y cuyes, cultiva y lo que cosecha  es para el consumo de su casa, también se dedica a un pequeño negocio de zapatos. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de víveres para iniciar con una tienda. Su meta es crecer en su tienda.
texts.en:
Lourdes is on her fourth loan cycle alongside her friends and companions of the Pucacruz group. This is a united group who always support each other to move forward, the loans help them to improve their businesses.

Lourdes lives in the outskirts of Valle en Cuenca parish, which enjoys a natural beauty as it is at the top of a mountain, from which one can view the countryside. The people work in country pursuits like raising livestock or agriculture and many go daily to the city for various jobs.

Lourdes is 23 years old, she lives with her common law husband and has two children of 4 and 1 years old and is very excited to be pregnant with her third child. Her husband works in the construction business as a bricklayer. She does not have her own home so lives in her mum’s house.

Lourdes takes care of the home and looks after her children, but to help her husband economically she raises livestock, pigs and guinea pigs. She also grows food for the household and has a small shoe business. 

The money from the loan is to buy groceries to start a shop. Her aim is to grow her shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia que fundó el grupo de crédito Pucacruz, le gusta su grupo por la amistad y compañerismo que existe, también los créditos le ayudan a salir en adelante con su familia. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural ya que se encuentra en lo más alto de una montaña y desde allí se observa los paisajes, su gente se dedica a las tareas del campo como la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a diario a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. 
La Señora. María tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña María pasa en casa y se dedica a la cría de pollos, cerdos, becerros y cuyes, también  a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos. Su meta es agrandar el negocio de los animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a partner who founded the loan group Pucacurz. She likes her group because of the friendship and fellowship that exists; also, the loans help her move forward with her family. She lives in the vicinity of the Cuenca Valley parish, a place where she enjoys the natural beauty, as it is located on top of a mountain and from there the scenery can be observed. The people engage in farm work, such as raising animals, agriculture, and many commute to the city daily to work in different activities. 

Mrs. Maria is 25 years old, she is married and as a result of her conjugal union she has conceived 2 children (1 and 2 years old).  Her husband is a construction worker, and the house where she lives is her own. 

Mrs. Maria spends her time at home and works raising chickens, pigs, calves, and guinea pigs. She also works in agriculture, for the home consumption and to sell. She will invest the money from the loan to purchase chickens and pigs. Her goal is expand the animal business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y su hijo desde hace varios años en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros is 36 years old and for several years has lived with her parents and her son in the district of Zaña, situated in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Milagros makes a living raising and selling farmyard animals and runs her business in the rear part of her home.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed for fattening the animals so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old married man with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a motorcycle transportation business that he started in order to employ himself. He faces challenges of weather changes and poor roads. However, he hopes to buy land and build a permanent house.

Robert needs a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia amable y gentil que se encuentra en su quinto crédito en el grupo de crédito Pucacruz, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural ya que se encuentra en lo más alto de una montaña y desde allí se observa los paisajes, su gente se dedica a las tareas del campo como la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a diario a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. 
La Señora. María tiene 48 años de edad, fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos,  dos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, su hijo menor de 17 años  estudia en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña María se dedica al trabajo que aprendió de sus padres el cual es la crianza de animales, tiene cerdos, cuyes, pollos y ganado, también se dedica a la siembra de verduras que son para la venta, cuando le llaman trabaja como jornalera. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is a friendly and helpful member of the communal bank Pucacruz and is in her fifth loan cycle. She lives in the outskirts of the Valle parish in Cuenca, a place of natural beauty due to its location at the top of a mountain. From here you can see the countryside. The locals work in rural jobs such as rearing animals and agriculture and many of them travel to the city every day to do various jobs. 

María is 48 years old and has produced 3 children during her marriage. Two of them are now grown up and married, and live independently, while her younger son, who is 17 years old, goes to a local school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and they live in their own house. María does the work she learnt from her parents, which is raising animals. She has pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and cattle. She also grows vegetables to sell and works as a day labourer when called upon. 

She will use the money from the loan to buy a dairy cow.

Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 35 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Melody has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Melody aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 59 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

Rosalina has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Diojayna

texts.en: Diojayna has been saving money to make home improvements, but most of the savings has gone toward household expenses. Now, she wants to buy  additional grocery goods to improve sales and revenue for her business. Therefore, Diojayna has requested a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell and generate more income to repair her house, along with the contribution of her savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Celiny

texts.en: Celiny searches for any possible way to obtain resources that will allow her to feed her family. Twenty years ago she began selling sandals. She thanks God and her clients for this occupation since the results of these sales have been very rewarding. Based on this success, Celiny is asking for a loan to buy kitchen utensils and plastic ware to sell which will allow her to continue to follow her dream of growing as an entrepreneur, always looking for the well-being of her family and the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils and plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Kateebe Farmers Group

texts.en: Tom is 48 years old, married, has eight children, and is a member of Kateebe Farmers Group. He lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a produce dealer, selling maize, coffee, and beans since 1992. He ventured into this business to have a source of income for the family. Tom needs a loan to buy beans, coffee, and maize to sell. Tom is hard working despite the challenge of weather which brings about low demand and supply.

loans.use: To buy beans, coffee and maize to sell

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda works hard to support her family. Emmalinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Emmalinda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy paint, wood, nails, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Emmalinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Emmalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, nails, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela, 51 years of age, is widowed and has six children. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost 12 years and earns a net income of PHP 700 daily. Her net income is usually spent on daily expenses at home. Due to a lack of capital to run her business, she's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to  purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, milk, beverages, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, milk, beverages, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 35 years old and married. She is blessed with five children who are attending school. She has been engaged in buying and reselling school supplies, plastics and kitchenware in the public market to help her husband gain income. She aims to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of her children. She would like to acquire more stock of the said products to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, Jennifer wants to take a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional stocks of school supplies, plastics, Tupperware and kitchenware to resell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies, plastics, Tupperware and kitchenware to resell

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nemesia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Nemesia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her business.

Nemesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 30 years old and married with six children who are in school, Maricris works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

Maricris has been in this business for three years.

In the future Maricris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy and sell nipa roofing

loans.name: Launiyada

texts.en:
Launiyada is a 31-year-old married woman with nine children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 12 years now she has been operating a retail shop. She used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell. She is still faced with the same challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital for expansion.
Launiyada will use the loan to add more curry powder, cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy more curry powder, cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is only 27.  She is from Dhupguri.  She lives with her husband and two young sons in the small village of Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.  Both Kalpana and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names.  However, their sons go to school and are in different grades in primary level.

Kalpana's husband Ganesh, 25, is associated with an agribusiness.  He has been in this business for the last five years.  He likes to work on his farmland and works tirelessly all day long to grow vegetables. This activity is the only source of income for the family. Kalpana is a homemaker.  She manages all the household work and looks after her husband and sons.  After managing all of these activities, she helps her husband in his agricultural works, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the produce to the market to sell. She is a hardworking woman who desires to better her family. Now they have decided to grow ladies fingers on their farm, which are in much demand in the present market, and which are widely used in Indian dishes.

Kalpana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan proceeds to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other items.  This loan will be very helpful for her business, enabling her to get ahead and to make progress in her business.  The earnings from this business, she dreams, will allow her to give a better education to her sons and give them a decent and better lifestyle.

She aspires to construct a concrete house for them to live in. 

She is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate ladies fingers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase her fall clothing inventory and equipment and pay for advertising

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto con su familia, en su propia casa que cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz) en el Caserío Pampa Flores s/n a 30 minutos de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, así como al comercio de plátano y venta de granos como arroz y soya desde hace 8 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old. She is married and lives with her family in her own house, which has public services (water and light), in the village of Pampa Flores, 30 minutes from Morropon. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been raising small animals, as well as selling bananas and basic grains such as rice and soy, for eight years. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN to purchase compost to maintain her planting of rice and in this way to have a propitious production to offer her customers and to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy compost to maintain her rice plantings.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for her fishing business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Letecia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from boarding house rentals and selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, gelatinas, sandías, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and son in the district of Morropon, a community with a hot climate whose people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells candies, soft drinks, gelatins, and watermelons. Her business is located in her home. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN to purchase a greater quantity of candies to stock her business and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of candies to stock her business.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Mayasa is a 60-year-old mother who is married and has five grown children. She is a hardworking African mother who dreams of changing her family's life. For six years now, Mayasa has managed to support her family with three small businesses: concrete where she buys one truck of stones and brick for concrete. Second is a soap business reselling on credit and lastly a fish business.  She manages all of her businesses herself and operates from 6 am to 6 pm daily. She is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her eighth loan request. She will use the loan to buy stones, soap and fish for her businesses. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to improve her soap business with enough stock and replenished her fish business with more fish. Mayasa received a profit that she used to cover household expenses together with keeping some aside for unforeseen events. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house. 

Mayasa will share this loan with her loan group "Bahari", which includes seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stones, soap and a stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 60 years old and married with one child who is in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, cream, coffee, sugar, spices, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, cream, coffee, sugar, and spices

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is 44 years old and happily married to Arthuro. God has blessed them with one child who is now in college. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their child well and they are helping each other to work for their family.

Jelita owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and she will sell it per piece for a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jelita desires that her business will continue to grow and she hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a twenty-two-year-old married male with one child and two dependents and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. After Isaac became a father, he came up with the idea of using his long-term savings from a cocoa plantation to start up a retail shop,  in hopes of improving on his household income. He works hard to ensure that all the daily expenditures  of his family are covered. He intends to use the loan from HOFOKAM to buy more stock like salt, sweets and baby powder to sell.

loans.use: To buy more stock like salt, sweets and baby powder to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin a little business of selling soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Reyna Liliana

texts.es:
Reyna Liliana tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, radica en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, gallinas y pavos) para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales menores para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Liliana is 38 years old. She lives with her partner in the district of Oyotún, a community whose people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells barnyard animals (ducks, chickens, and turkeys) to help her husband with the family expenses. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase a greater quantity of small animals to offer her customers and in this way to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, fish, chicken, onions, garlic, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Jhielchearl

texts.en:
Jhielchearl is still studying and has had previous loans from GDMPC that she used for her school fees and expenses. She wants to complete her degree and practice her profession in order to become successful someday and with a better education, nothing is impossible. She never wasted her time and on weekends, she used to help out with fixing their house's mess.

She requested a new loan recently to pay school tuition fee for the 1st semester this school year. Jhielchearl is hopeful not only to continue her studies, but to complete them and be able to work for a better future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the 1st semester of the school year

loans.name: Glorife

texts.en:
While her husband works abroad, Glorife runs a transportation business, providing transportation services and rental. Her tenant remitted a daily rental to her, which contributed more to their household expenses while waiting for the support from her husband. 

She joined GDMPC to gain access to any services offered. She borrowed a loan just recently to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net and gasoline.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alma has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena, 28 years of age, is married to a private employee and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost four years, and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase eggplant, bitter gourd, squash, and string bean seedlings. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase eggplant, bitter gourd, squash, and string bean seedlings.

loans.name: Nohemí Adriana

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas Nohemí se levanta a arreglar su pequeña pulpería que inició hace cinco años con el apoyo de su mamá, vendiendo snacks, golosinas y gaseosas. Siempre ubica cada envase de suavizante de ropa o jabón de baño en orden, pues para ella es trascendental que noten que el orden e higiene es importante para brindarles a sus clientes lo mejor. Con tan solo 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo de tres años, a quien desea ver desempeñarse profesionalmente en un futuro con los ingresos de su negocio y el de su esposo como propietario de un taller mecánico, ya que debido a problemas económicos ella solo pudo llegar hasta segundo año de secundaria.
Ahora Nohemí es bendecida con un capital de trabajo más grande, el cual le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda. No obstante, sus deseos de superación no llegan hasta allí, por lo que piensa seguir adelante con su trabajo, por esta razón necesita de un préstamo para incrementar sus productos, comprar más papel higiénico, shampoos, jabón, huevos, pan, entre otros. Para ella es un sueño llegar a convertir su pulpería en un minisúper, pero primero piensa establecerse en un puesto en el mercado para seguir ahorrando y así cumplir con esa meta profesional.
texts.en:
Every morning Nohemí wakes up to set up her little grocery store that she opened five years ago with the help of her mother. In the beginning she sold snacks, sweets and fizzy drinks. Now Nohemí has all her clothes softeners and soaps neatly in order as, for her, it is very essential that customers see that that tidiness and hygiene is very important as Nohemí provides her customers with the best service. At just 26 years old, Nohemí has a three-year-old son, whom Nohemí wants to see become a professional in the future. Nohemí hopes that her son will become a professional with the help of her and her husband's income (Nohemí's husband has a garage where he fixes cars). For financial reasons, Nohemí was only able to study up to second year at secondary school.

Nohemí nowadays is blessed to have more working capital than previously. This has allowed her to make improvements to her home. Nevertheless, Nohemí's desire to do better does not stop there and she wants to move forward with her work. Because of this, Nohemí needs to apply for a loan in order to increase her stock and buy more lavatory paper, shampoos, soap, eggs, bread and more. It is Nohemí's dream to expand her little grocery store into a mini-supermarket but first she wants to set up a stall at the market in order to save money and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy more lavatory paper, shampoo, soap, eggs, bread and more.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a parent of seven children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Norma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as paint, wood, fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as paint, wood, fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is married and has three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines. Merlyn is a farmer and grows fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her garden and to save more for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is divorced and has four children. She is 58 years old and lives in Dolores Clarin, Philippines. Marita sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities. Marita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Marita hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Eugelyn

texts.en: Buying and selling vegetables in the public market has been Eugelyn’s primary activity for almost three years. It is her way of helping her husband to earn income. She is 33 years old and has two school-aged children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to meet their daily needs. She would like to acquire more vegetables to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, Eugelyn wants to take out a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more garlic, onions, ginger, beans, cabbages, eggplants and tomatoes to sell. Being a diligent mother, she believes that, someday, she will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more garlic, onions, ginger, beans, cabbages, eggplants and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Rachael has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Al entrar al negocio de María José, el olor de la comida recorre por todo el establecimiento, llamando a los clientes como una corriente seductora. La exquisita cuchara de esta mujer de 35 años, es conocida desde hace siete años, con una muy buena reputación. A pesar de no haber tenido estudios universitarios, como madre soltera de dos hijos, piensa seguir adelante como comerciante, para brindarles un buen futuro.
María José solo cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y hermanos, por lo que ha solicitado de otros recursos para seguir con su negocio. Anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar, carnes, salsas, entre otros. Afortunadamente los resultados fueron muy positivos, por lo que ahora solicita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar gaseosas, frutas para hacer frescos, verduras, carnes y arroz crudo para la comida. De esta forma, sabe que cumplirá con su sueño de seguir creciendo, ya que venderá más y sus ingresos aumentarán, asegurando un seguro estable para sus hijos.
texts.en:
When entering María José's business, the aroma of food fills the building calling on customers to enter this seductive environment. Thirty-five-year-old María's exquisite cooking has been well-known for seven years and she has a very good reputation. Despite having no university studies behind her, as a single a mother to two children María wants to move forward as a businesswoman in order to offer her children a better future.

María receives support only from her parents and siblings. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to continue with her business. Previously María had applied for a loan in order to buy items to cook (meat, sauces and more). Fortunately, María had very positive results and so is now applying for a loan in order to buy more fizzy drinks, fruits for making fresh juices, vegetables, meat and rice for preparing meals. This way María knows that she can achieve her dream of continuing to expand her business. María will sell more and his incomes will increase, giving her children a stable future.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, fruits to make fresh juices, and vegetables, meat and rice.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other materials for her fishing business. Merlita has been in this business for three years. Merlita earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mirna Luisa

texts.es:
Para los niños doña Mirna de 50 años, es la Santa Claus de todos los días, pues como un Disney World les ofrece con una sonrisa amable un juguete con el cual divertirse. Ya sea una jirafa, un cocodrilo o un carro de la película “Cars”, ella se encarga comercializar todos los juguetes que los niños tanto desean. No obstante ella no solo consiente a los pequeños, también las mujeres la buscan para comprar cosméticos y bisutería, por lo que abarca dos distintos mercados desde hace cinco años. A pesar de  haber llegado a segundo año de secundaria, ella siempre quiso trabajar, además es madre soltera de dos hijos, de los cuales se siente orgullosa poder sustentarles un futuro estable. 
Para Mirna sus hermanos e hijos son su todo, pues además de ser su familia, son quienes la han apoya siempre, por lo que a diario lucha para que su negocio siga creciendo. Ahora necesita de un préstamo, pues piensa extender sus productos y quiere comprar bolsos nuevos para venderlos y así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, además de captar a nuevos. En un futuro se mira como una persona autosuficiente, quien gracias a su arduo trabajo podrá cumplirlo.
texts.en:
For children, Mirna, 50 years old, is a Santa Claus every day, since like Disney World, with a friendly smile she offers them a toy to play with. Whether it be a giraffe, crocodile, or a car from the movie Cars, she undertakes selling all the toys children want so badly. However, she not only indulges the little ones, women also come to her looking to purchase cosmetics and costume jewelry, so she has addressed two different markets for the past five years. Despite having studied through the second year of secondary school, she always wanted to work.  In addition, she is a single mother of two children, for whom she is proud to be able to provide a stable future.

For Mirna, her siblings and children are everything, since in addition to being her family, they are who have always supported her, and for whom she strives daily so that her business can continue growing. Now she needs a loan, since the plans to expand her products and she wants to purchase new handbags to sell, and in this way offer more variety for her customers, and to attract new ones.  In the future, she sees herself as a self-sufficient person who, thanks to her arduous work, could accomplish it.

loans.use: to purchase new handbags to sell them.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en: Levy is married and has three children. She is 61 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Philippines. Levy sells smart-phone loads to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 to provide capital for her phone re-loading business. Levy has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Levy hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to provide capital for her phone reloading business.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia has operating a general store for six years in order to make a living. With her generated revenue, she repaid her previous loan used successfully for the business.

To improve her offerings, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

With this activity, she is hoping to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 46, is from Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is a single parent bravely raising three children.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sells one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Teresita is now trying to expand her pig business and has decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 43 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, reside en el Distrito de Santo Tomás en su propia casa, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, actividad que desarrolla desde hace varios años, también se dedica a la venta de helados, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old and has a stable household with her partner and two children. Delia lives in the Santo Tomás district, in a house that she owns. Delia's house has access to water and electricity. (Santo Tomás is in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. The people here make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade).

Delia makes a living in farming, mainly growing the Catimor variety of coffee. Delia has been doing this work for a number of years, and also sells ice creams. Delia has applied for a loan of 4500 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy manure and pay labourers for looking after coffee crops. With this loan, Delia can earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay labourers for looking after coffee crops.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
Edgar a la edad de 55 años es un Señor donde los años no pasan desde hace 12 años se dedica a la siembra de trigo y la crianza de ganado y en sus tiempos libres trabaja como albañil. Edgar es un hombre el cual dirige todos sus esfuerzos a sus hijos y esposa. Es una persona que siempre esta con los ánimos en altos y con los mejores deseo de superación.
Anteriormente Edgar había recibido un préstamo el cual le fue de mucha utilidad ya que pudo comprar alambre, insumos agrícolas y pagarles a otras personas que le ayudaron a hacer el trabajo en la finca. Ahora él necesita de un nuevo préstamo para la compra de dos terneros, alambres para mejorar lo cercos de su finca, y de igual forma semillas de trigo y de maíz para sembrarlas. El crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mejorar las condiciones de su finca. Sus planes a futuro son hacer un nuevo préstamo para la compra de un motor para la extracción de agua de un pozo.
texts.en:
Edgar, 55 years old, is a gentleman who the years don't affect.  For the past 12 years, he has worked growing wheat and raising livestock and in his free time, he works in construction. Edgar is a man who directs all his efforts toward his children and his wife. He is a person who is always in high spirits and with the strongest wishes to improve himself.  

Previously, Edgar received a loan which was very useful since he could purchase wire, agricultural supplies, and pay the other people who help him with the farm work. Now he needs a new loan to purchase 2 calves, wire to improve the fences on the farm, and also wheat and corn seeds to sow. The loan he requests will be a great help since he will be able to improve the condition of his farm. His future plans are to get another loan to purchase a motor to pump water from a well.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, wire and corn and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 30 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janice has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Janice aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed, vitamins, antiparasitics, and to improve the pasture.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca owns and operates a business selling fruit in the market to make a living. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns well to supplement her family's needs. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying fruits to sell. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more fruits to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: In 2008, Genara learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Genara tried her luck at doing a business focused on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Genara took another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Genara looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and equipment for her fishing business.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
El señor Jhon se dedica actualmente al negocio de la confección en compañía de su esposa.
Luego de haber trabajado en muchas fabricas de este mismo tipo, decidió iniciar con su propio taller y realizar sus propias prendas.
Es un hombre muy luchador y enfocado y más aun ahora que se entero que viene un hijo en camino.
Su alegría de ser padre lo motiva para seguir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
El solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, agujas y encajes.
Estos elementos le permitirían continuar trabajando y capitalizar su negocio.
Su mayor desafío es su hijo, que llegara en un momento económico muy difícil para él y su pareja.
texts.en:
Jhon currently works in a dressmaking business with his wife.

After having worked in many factories of the same type, he decided to open his own workshop and make his own clothing.

He is a very determined and focused man and even more so now that he found out he has a child on the way.

His joy at being a father motivates him to continue on and achieve his dreams.

He asks for this loan to invest it in the purchase of supplies such as fabric, thread, needles and lace.

These things will permit him to continue working and provide capital for his business.

His greatest challenge is his child, who will arrive at a very difficult economic time for him and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Mom Group

texts.en: Mom is 34 years old. She is a married woman with two children in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Mom is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Mom hopes that she can buy cows to breed and her children can get higher education.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 50 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Ana Maria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ana Maria has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ana Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Godella

texts.en:
