Godella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Godella has been in this business for 28 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net.

Leonila has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un joven muy emprendedor y con un enfoque muy marcado en la obtención de sus propios recursos.
Está dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas en el municipio de Sabaneta, Antioquia desde hace poco tiempo y ya que apenas está empezando y tomando fuerza en su negocio, necesita una ayuda económica para comprar algunos insumos para sus preparaciones y utensilios de cocina.
Actualmente solo cuenta con una sombrilla para su puesto de trabajo y considera que es importante surtir su negocio con estos elementos.
Gracias a su simpatía y cordialidad con sus clientes puede empezar a forjarse un futuro muy prometedor con su negocio.
su mayor desafio es la falta de experiencia y el poco tiempop que lleva en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a very enterprising young man with a specific focus on earning his own resources.

He has worked selling fast food in the municipality of Sabaneta, Antioquia for a short time and since he is just beginning and strengthening his business, he needs economic help to purchase supplies for his preparations and kitchen utensils.

He currently only has an umbrella as his workplace and thinks it is important to stock his business with these things.

Thanks to the kindness and friendliness of his customers, he can began to forge a very promising future with his business.

His greatest challenge is his lack of experience and the short time that he has been in the market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Nhoeng's Group

texts.en:
Nhoeng, 24, is widowed with three dependent children who are all still too small for school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about KHR 40,000 per day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Nheong received her fourth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gasoline, fishing net, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline and fishing net

loans.name: Carlos Pedro

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja transportando personas a diversos lugares en una mototaxi que tiene, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, honesto y sobre todo porque se preocupa por el bienestar de sus pasajeros y cumple siempre con las leyes de tránsito.
Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un equipo de sonido para que pueda disfrutar sus momentos libres en su vivienda junto a su familia, de esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder "Estudiar una carrera profesional".
texts.en:
Carlos is an enterprising young man, 19 years old and single, who lives in Ica with his family.

For the past year he has worked transporting people to various places in a motorcycle taxi that he has. It is going very well for him because he is very responsible, honest and, above all, because he is concerned for the well-being of his passengers and always follows the rules of the road. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to purchase a sound system so that he can enjoy his free time at home with his family, and in this way continue putting forth effort to be able to study a professional course.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system.

loans.name: Martha Edita

texts.es:
Martha Edita tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto con su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cuyes, pollos y conejos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, su hijo brinda servicio de transporte público mediante su mototaxi, Martha ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Edita is 63 years old. She lives with her child in the district of Nueva Arica, a community with a varied climate whose population works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province which is in Lambayeque region on the north cost of Perú. 

She works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, chickens and rabbits. Her business is located in the back part of her home. Her son provides a public transportation service on his motorcycle taxi. Martha has asked for Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Nelta

texts.en:
Nelta has been growing and harvesting rice to sell in town. She has had this business for more than twenty years, and this is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to repay her previous loan used for farming inputs successfully. 

Nelta took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to save for her future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Aquilina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from  selling vegetables. Aquilina is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell for her buy-and-sell fruit business.

Aquilina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fuits to sell

loans.name: Eab

texts.en:
Eab, 43, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Chhoeng Prey district. She has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 23 years and the current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the first loan for Eab with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Yolanda es repostera y necesita un credito para comprar harina, azucar y un horno Yolanda es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Yolanda is single; she has no children and lives with her parents in a brick and cement house, which belongs to her, in La Paz. Yolanda is a baker and needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and an oven. Yolanda provides the only source of income for her home and that is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and an oven

loans.name: Aladino

texts.es:
Aladino tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cercana al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y brinda servicios de mano de obra agrícola cultivando maíz y camote, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aladino, 33 years old, lives in the district of Zaña, a community close to the Jequetepeque river valley, which has allowed it to develop itself through agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, and which is located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. 

He works raising small animals and offers services as an agricultural laborer growing corn and sweet potato.  He asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevo soles to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Henry Eduardo

texts.es:
Henry vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara, Antioquia y desde allí presta el servicio de transporte de personas a diferentes veredas de dicho municipio. Es una actividad muy común en esta parte de la región y es una de las principales fuentes de ingresos de sus habitantes.
Esta actividad le ha permitido a Henry sostener a su familia durante mucho tiempo.
El antes trabajaba como conductor de bus, pero cuando su contrato se termino el decidió iniciarse en esta actividad.
Hoy en día es muy conocido en el municipio por su buen servicio y calidad humana.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una moto nueva y así poder poner a trabajar a otra persona, de este modo mejorara sus ingresos y le brindara una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Henry lives in the municipality of Santa Bárbara, Antioquia, where he provides transportation services for people from different areas of the municipality. It is a common activity in this part of the region, and one of the main sources of income for its inhabitants.

This work has allowed Henry to support his family for a long time. He used to work as a bus driver, but when his contract ended, he decided to begin this activity. Today he is very well known in the municipality for his good service and strong character.

He asks for a loan in order to purchase a new motorcycle so that he can employ another person; with this, he will improve his earnings and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Maurene

texts.en:
Maurene is 33 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Maurene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
A pesar de no ejercer profesionalmente la medicina, don Marcos siempre se ha interesado en la salud de las personas, razón por la cual se dedico a la venta de medicamentos en comarcas y pueblos, lugares donde los centro de salud no cubren todos medicamentos de la receta médica. El tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y tiene seis hijos, los dos menores asisten a clases y el mayor es él que le ayuda en la distribución del producto. Inicio en el negocio hace 20 años, su esposa ha sido su mayor soporte y juntos han luchado por el bienestar de su familia.
Él solicita el préstamo para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar medicamentos, aquellos para el dolor de cabeza, los problemas estomacales, el estrés, la gripe, la tos, entre otras enfermedades. Es una hombre trabajador y un padre ejemplar, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que lograra obtener más clientela y al mismo tiempo más ganancia, lo que le brindará estabilidad económica. Uno de sus planes futuros es expandir su negocio y comercializar en otras comunidades, dando así de respuesta a los malestares de las personas.
texts.en:
Despite not practicing medicine professionally, Marcos has always been interested in people's health, so he works selling medicines in communities and villages, places where the the health center doesn't have all the medicines for a prescription. He began his business 20 years ago; his wife has been his greatest support and together they have striven for the well-being of their family.  

He asks for this loan to expand the production of his capital. He needs to purchase medicines, such as those for headaches, stomach problems, stress, the flu, coughs, and other sicknesses. He is a hard-working man and an exemplary father. He places his confidence in the loan, since he will be able to get a larger customer base and at the same time more earnings, which will offer him economic stability.  One of his future plans is to expand his business and sell in other communities, in this way providing an answer for people's maladies.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is 36 years old and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Moungkul Borey district, Sopheak raises pigs and sells snacks. Having been in these businesses for 16 years, she manages to earn about 70,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.
 
This is Sopheak's eighth microloan with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her family to have sufficient food. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to gain more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is from Dhupguri. She is married and a mother of two sons, who are students. Her family consists of her sons and her husband, Andharu, who is a 39-year-old farmer. They live in their own kachha house (straw, mud and bamboo-made) in West Magurmari of Jalpaiguri district. Both Dipali and her husband are uneducated, and they only can sign their names. One of her sons is in college, and the other is in grade 5.

Dipali's husband is an agronomist. He loves to work with soil. He has a small plot of farmland, where he works tirelessly from dawn to dusk and grows different kinds of vegetables and paddy rice. The demand for paddy rice is very good in the region, as it is the staple food of the local people. 

He has many customers who want to buy vegetables and rice from him, as he supplies good-quality products at reasonable rates. But, it is a competitive market, so his income is not sufficient to provide financial sustenance to the family. He wants to grow more paddy rice, but his main obstacle is funds.

Dipali has decided to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She wants to utilize the loan to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things to grow more quality products to satisfy her customers.

She hopes the loan will provide her with additional income to reach her goals, which are to support her sons with higher education and construct a better and decent house for them to live in.

She is thankful to BJS as well as Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase paddy rice seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Nahum

texts.es:
Nahum es un joven emprendedor, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando principalmente el cacao, uva y frejol. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajador y porque cuida muy bien de sus cultivos para obtener productos de excelente calidad.
Nahum está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes y plaguicidas para poder realizar el mantenimiento de las plantas y así al final de la cosecha pueda obtener productos de mayor calidad con lo cual incrementará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nahum is a young entrepreneur, he is 25 years old, single, and lives in San Martin alongside his family. For more than 5 years he has made a living from agriculture, cultivating mainly cacao, grapes, and beans. He is doing very well because he is a very responsible, hardworking person, and because he takes good care of his crops to obtain products of an excellent quality. 

Nahum is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him, he will be able to purchase inputs like fertilizers and pesticides to be able to give maintenance to the plants. That way, at the end of the crop season he will obtain products of greater quality, with which he will increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) for the plantation's maintenance

loans.name: Geydi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Son las siete de la mañana y ya se escucha el palmeo constante de la masa, Geydi se esmera en darle la forma aplanada de una tortilla, principal complemento del plato de los nicaragüenses. Ella tiene 25 años, está casada y tiene un hijo. A pesar de haber culminado su carrera universitaria de contabilidad pública, no encontró trabajo en el que pudo haberse desempeñado profesionalmente. Sin Embargo, no se dio por vencida y con el apoyo de su mamá, fortalecieron el negocio de la familia, la venta de tortillas.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar insumos, tales como masa y leña.  Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, brindarle salud y educación de calidad. Es una mujer emprendedora e inteligente,  una de sus metas es hacer crecer el negocio y comprar una cocina industrial para incrementar la capacidad de su negocio. Al mismo tiempo no pierde la esperanza de encontrar un trabajo en el que ponga en práctica sus habilidades de contadora.
texts.en:
It is seven in the morning and already one can hear the constant patting of the corn flour. Geyde takes great pains in giving the tortilla its flat shape, the primary component in Nicraguan dishes. She is 25 years old, married and has a child. Despite completing a university degree in public accounting, she could not find work that she could do professionally. However, she didn't give up and, with the help of her mom, they strengthened the family business, tortilla sales.

She asks for a loan to increase the production of her business; she needs to purchase supplies such as corn flour and firewood. She places her confidence in the loan since she desires to improve her family's living conditions, and offer them health and quality education. She is an enterprising and intelligent woman. One of her goals is to grow her business and purchase an industrial range to increase the business's capacity. At the same time, she doesn't lose hope of finding a job where she can put to use her skills as an accountant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as corn flour and firewood.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su tia en La Paz, en una casa de acabado fino que es de su propiedad Susan trabaja en una institucion de salud en el area de limpieza pero ella quiere tener mejores condiciones de vida por eso necesita un credito para pagar un curso de actualizacion en enfermeria  Susan es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Susan is single, doesn't have any children, and lives with her aunt in La Paz in s finely finished house that is her property. Susan works in a health institution in the cleaning area but she wants to improve her life situation and for this she needs a loan to pay for a continuing education course in nursing. Susan is the only source of income in her home and for this she needs its help.

loans.use: to pay for a continuing education course in nursing

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia esta casada tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Pacallo en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Julia tiene una tienda de articulos de piscina y un pequeño restaurant Julia necesita un credito para comprar una maquina que le permita cocinar pollos a la broaster  Por el momento Julia es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julia is married and has two children. She lives in her own house made of brick and cement in the community of Pacallo.

Julia has a shop where she sells swimming pool supplies and also a small restaurant. She needs a loan in order to buy a machine for cooking roasted chickens. At the moment, Julia is the only one generating household income, so she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy a chicken rotisserie machine.

loans.name: Liliam Marleny

texts.es:
Liliam Marleny tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo y familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años, también se dedica a la compra y venta de fruta en su domicilio para posteriormente comercializarlo en su bodeguita, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liliam Marleny is 30 years old and lives with her husband and family in the district of Buenos Aires, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in the province of Morropon, in the Piura region, on the north coast of Perú.

She has worked to sell groceries for several years, and also buys and sells fruit from her home in order to market it in her store. She has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a larger amount of products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is a 30-year-old, self-employed woman from Noramarg village in the Ararat region of Armenia. She lives with her husband, her father and her 1-year-old daughter.

Together with her family, Hamest has been engaged in agricultural activities for 11 years. They own agricultural land in the village and cultivate potatoes, beans, and tomatoes. They sell their fruits and vegetables in the local market.

In order to expand their agribusiness and make it more profitable, Hamest and her family need some additional capital. In particular, Hamest has applied for a loan in the amount of $3,000 to restore their barn, pay for livestock and finance soil-plowing activities. Hamest really needs support to succeed, so she asks that lenders help her and her family to implement their goals and grow their agribusiness.

loans.use: to expand her business by restoring her family's barn, purchasing livestock and paying for soil-plowing activities

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es una persona muy juiciosa y dedicada, estudio una Técnica En Electrónica y desde que se graduó decidió empezar a aplicar los conocimientos obtenidos ya que ser independiente es algo que siempre había soñado.
Lleva en esta actividad hace aproximadamente 15 años y ya tiene una clientela muy bien establecida que periódicamente solicitan sus servicios.
Entre sus actividades principales se puede destacar el mantenimiento a aparatos electrónicos y electrodomésticos.
Es un hombre muy conocido en el sector donde trabaja gracias a su buena atención y disposición.
Actualmente necesita renovar sus herramientas y es por eso que solicita un crédito, pues desea compra alicates, pinzas, entre otros.
Este crédito le permitirá ser más competitivo y podrá continuar consiguiendo recursos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Cesar is a very sensible and dedicated person. He got a technical degree in electronics and after graduating, he decided to begin to use the knowledge he gained since being independent is something he had always been his dream.

He has done this work for approximately 15 years and has a very well-established customer base that periodically ask for his services.

Among his primary activities, repairing electronics and household appliances stand out.   

He is a very well-known man in the area where he works, thanks to his good attention and disposition.

At the moment, he needs to update his tools and for this he asks for a loan, since he wants to purchase wire cutters and electrical pliers, among others. 

This loan will permit him to be more competitive and to be able to continue earning resources to sustain his children and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer es soltero no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres  en la comunidad de Curva Pucara en una casa de adobe Wilmer es agricultor pero tambien trabaja como encargado de limpieza en una empresa de recojo de basura Wilmer tiene una vaca que es de su propiedad pero esta al cuidado de sus padres, Wilmer necesita un credito para comprar otra vaca y así aumentar su ganado Wilmer es el unico sustento de su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Wilmer is single, he does not have children, and he lives with his parents in the community of Curva Pucara in an adobe house. Wilmer is a farmer but also works as a janitor in a garbage collection company. Wilmer has a cow that belongs to him but is under the care of his parents. Wilmer needs a loan to purchase another cow and that way increase his livestock. Wilmer provides the only livelihood for his home and that is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el Caserío San Lorenzo, una comunidad rural del distrito de Pucará, su clima es caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de variedad de frutas, es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza junto con su familia para una mejor calidad de vida, tiene sembrado una parcela de arroz.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agapito is 43 years old. He lives with his partner and their four children in the village of San Lorenzo, a rural community in the district of Pucará, where the climate is warm and the population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, and which is located in the province of Jaén, part of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

He works in agriculture and selling a variety of fruits. He is an enterprising father who works hard with his family to have a better quality of life and has planted a rice field. 

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer for his rice crop and in this way have a better product to offer his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es divorciado tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Pacallo en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Juan trabaja como empleado de seguridad en un hotel y necesita un credito para construir unas habitaciones en un terreno que es de su propiedad, de esa manera podra mejorar sus ingresos pues Juan quiere cobrar alquileres, Juan es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Juan is divorced; he has 2 children and lives in the community of Pacallo in a brick and cement house that he rents. Juan works as a security guard in a hotel and needs a loan to build some rooms on a plot of land that is his property. In this way, he will be able to increase his income since he wants to rent them out. Juan is the only source of income in his household, so he needs its help.

loans.use: to construct some rooms on a plot of land that is his property.

loans.name: Sakun's Group

texts.en:
Sakun, 42, is married with four children. She resides in a rural village of the Dambe district of Kampong Cham province.

To support her family, for 22 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava. Together, they can earn approximately 70,000 KHR per day and can save approximately 40,000 KHR per day for future needs.

Sakun is with VisionFund for this loan cycle and is leading her group in seeking this loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 53 years old and married with four children. Enriqueta works hard to provide for her family.

To earn a living, she runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years. She earns additional income by selling coconut wine.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, eggs, and noodles. Notably, Enriqueta has borrowed and successfully repaid two previous loans from NWTF. Enriqueta aspires to build and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., canned goods, coffee, eggs, and noodles) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a 51-year-old, married woman with six children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

To earn a living, she has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Iluminada has been in this business for 3 years.

Iluminada is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Iluminada would like to save enough money to provide a more secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Aunque el tiempo pase, los ánimos de trabajar no desaparecen en Rosa María, una mujer de 55 años de edad, que ha luchado día a día para sacar a su familia adelante. Hace tres años y medio estableció una pulpería, en la que inició vendiendo frijoles cocidos y helados, poco a poco añadió nuevos productos hasta establecer un negocio estable, una pulpería. Su principal apoyo ha sido su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, dos de ellos le envían remesas para seguir progresando y lograr un futuro seguro y tranquilo. 
Rosa solicita el préstamo para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, así como arroz, frijoles; también aceite, condimentos, pastas, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela hacer crecer su negocio, ganar más clientela y al mismo tiempo elevar sus ganancias. Es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, una de sus metas es establecer una distribuidora, por lo tanto seguirá luchando hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Although time passes, the energy to work has not disappeared in Rosa María, a 55-year-old woman who has fought day by day to carry her family forward. Three and a half years ago, she established a general store where she began by selling cooked beans and ice cream; little by little she added new products until she established a stable business, the general store. Her main support has been her life partner and her three children; two of them send her money so that she may keep progressing, and may achieve a secure and peaceful future.

Rosa asks for a loan to increase the production of her capital; it requires that she buy basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, condiments, pasta, sodas, mineral water, candy, and cleaning products, among other things. She places her confidence in the financing, as she longs to grow her business, to gain more clients, and at the same time to improve her earnings. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman. One of her goals is to establish herself as a distributor, and therefore she will continue fighting until she achieves this.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, oil, condiments, pasta, sodas, mineral water, candy, and cleaning products, among other things.

loans.name: Ma. Ivony

texts.en:
Ma. Ivony is a 48-year-old, single woman.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Specifically, she raises pigs, which she has been doing for 4 years now.

Ma. Ivony is now requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Notably, she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Ivony would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, 39, is married and has three children. She resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. For the last 11 years, she has been growing rice. She is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Phal has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Phal, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos ella vive en la comunidad de Achacachi en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad  Martha es vendedora ambulante de diversos productos  y quiere un credito para comprar ropa deportiva para su negocio Martha por el momento es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Martha lives with her partner and has two children. She lives in the community of Achacachi in an adobe house that is her property. Martha is an itinerant vendor with a variety of products. She wants a loan to buy sports clothing for her business. Martha at this time is the only source of income in her household, and so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy sports clothing for her business

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Gilberto trabaja como encargado de bodega en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite mantener la economía de su familia. Gilberto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera, teja, clavos y para pagar la mano de obra para hacer el cambio del techo dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Gilberto is 52 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. Gilberto works as a warehouse manager in a business near his home, and it allows him to maintain the economy of his family. Gilberto is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of wood, shingles, and nails and to pay for labor to change the roof of the house, given that it is deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy wood, shingles, and nails and to pay for labor to change the roof, which has deteriorated.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: Lizeth es soltera y no tiene hijos ella vive en El alto en una casa de adobe junto a sus familiares Lizeth es ayudante de ventas y quiere poner su negocio propio por lo que pide un prestamo para comprar mercadería (ropa) y mejorar sus ingresos Lizeth es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Lizeth is single and has no children. She lives in El Alto with her family members in a house of adobe. Lizeth is a sales assistant and wants to set up her own business, for which she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (clothing) and improve her income. Lizeth is the only source of income in her household, and so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Jhovana

texts.es: Jhovana vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo, ella vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Churuhata Belen en una casa de adobe  Jhovana trabaja elaborando quesos y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera  que le sirva para incrementar su produccion aunque su pareja trabaja como ayudante de albañil Jhovana necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Jhovana lives with her partner and has a son. She lives with her parents in the community of Churuhata Belen in an adobe house. Jhovana works making cheeses and needs a loan to buy a dairy cow, which will serve for increasing her production. Although her partner works as a mason's helper, Jhovana needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out improvements in the store, improving the visual aspect of the shop to the liking of the clientele and to buy new brands and styles of shoes.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 37 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nazirakhon

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере   Назирахон  занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания.    Более  20 лет она занимается земледелием. Ей  44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет   8 детей. Некоторые из них совершеннолетние, а некоторые несовершеннолетние. Она является основной кормилицей семьи. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000  сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farmland is the main type of business and  source of  livelihood in Tajikistan. Many people here, such as Nazirakhon, work the land and support themselves in this way. Nazirakhon has been farming for over 20 years. She is 44 years old. She is married and has eight children. Some of them are already adults and others still underage. Nazirakhon is the main breadwinner in the family. Her husband helps her in her business. She plans to develop her business but lacks the funds to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus  has been operating a fishing business, selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. For more than fifteen years, she had sustained this business and was able to provide the needs of her family. She repaid successfully her previous loan used for fishing. 

 With her determination to have more income, she put up a retail business in their village and it runs well. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery products to sell. She wants to improve the business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Geancarlos

texts.es:
Geancarlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace 1 año se trabaja transportando a personas a diversos lugares de la ciudad en una mototaxi que maneja, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, respetuoso, amable y sobre todo porque siempre respeta las señales de tránsito. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Geancarlos está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar vestimentas para poder iniciar un pequeño negocio de servicios de Show Infantil, de esta manera obtendrá un ingreso adicional que más adelante podrá utilizarlo para poder cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional".
texts.en:
Geancarlos is a young entrepreneur. He is 20 years old and is single. He lives in Ica with his family.

He has been working for one year transporting people to various places in the city in a motorcycle taxi that he drives. It is going very well for him because he is very responsible, respectful, friendly, and above all because he always respects the traffic signals. He has a great will to advance and to be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

Geancarlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy clothing to begin a little service business putting on performances for children. In this way he will obtain an additional income that in the future he can use to accomplish one of his greatest dreams: "to begin to study for a professional career."

loans.use: to buy clothing to put on performances for children

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business and purchase merchandise which motivates her since she will have more progress for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es soltero pero tiene un hijo Hugo vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Hugo es taxista y necesita un credito para pagar reparaciones en su vehiculo Hugo es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Hugo is single but has a son. He lives in La Paz in a brick and mortar house that he rents. He is a taxi driver and needs a loan to pay for car repairs. Hugo is the sole source of income in his household and that’s why he needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 17 años. Hace algunos años el esposo de Eugenia se vio obligado a emigrar al extranjero en busca de mejores oportunidades. Eugenia es quien se encarga del hogar y quien lleva la responsabilidad de la economía del hogar. Desde hace 6 años dio inicio a un negocio de pupusas y bebidas lo cual le permite ajustar para cubrir las principales necesidades del hogar. Eugenia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, polines, y hierro para reparar el techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 49 years old and lives in her own house along with her 17 year old daughter. A few years ago, Eugenia's husband felt compelled to emigrate abroad in search of better opportunities. Eugenia runs the household and is responsible for the household economy. Six years ago she started a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and drinks, which allows her to adjust to meet the the main needs of the household. 

Eugenia is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheeting, roof supports and iron to repair the roof of her house and to cement its floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheeting, roof supports and iron to repair the roof of her house and to cement its floor.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, cream, etc.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Melanie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Banteay Meanchey province, Sophorn is 46 years old and a mother of four children. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, one is under school-aged and two are in school. She deals with her daily cost of living via a fruit and vegetable selling business as the main source of income and  also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

Sophorn has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for ages and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. The positive impact of her loans allows her to improve her lifestyle in a gradual pace and to keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she teams up a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more fruit and vegetables for resale. She hopes to make more income so that she can enlarge her current business and explore a new business to double her income.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: Fidelia es soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en El Alto junto a sus familiares Fidelia es panadera y se dedica a vender lo que en Bolivia se conoce como llauchas (una especie de empanada o pan con relleno de queso) y necesita un credito para comprar insumos (azucar, harina, queso) para incrementar su produccion de llauchas Fidelia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Fidelia is single, has a son and lives in El Alto together with her relatives. Fidelia is a baker and makes a living selling what are known as llauchas in Bolivia (a kind of empanada, or bread filled with cheese). She needs a loan to buy supplies (sugar, flour, cheese) to increase her production of llauchas. Fidelia is the only source of income in her household, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy supplies (sugar, flour, cheese) to increase her production of llauchas.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepcion es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en El Alto junto a sus familiares Concepcion trabaja como empleada y quiere un credito para comprar material de construccion para hacer arreglar su casa Concepcion es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, el marido ha perdido el trabajo recientemente, por eso necesita su ayuda pues ella quiere tener mejores condiciones de vida, las reparaciones en su casa son urgentes
texts.en: Concepcion is married and has one son. She lives with her family in El Alto. Concepcion has spent all of her life as a worker. She wants a loan in order to buy building materials to fix up her house. Concepcion is the only one in her household who brings in an income. Her husband recently lost his job and so Concepcion needs help. She wants to improve her living conditions. The repairs to Concepcion's house are urgent.

loans.use: to buy building materials to fix up her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 47 years of age, is widowed and has three children. Maria owns and has operated a retail store in her village for almost four years, earning a net income of 2,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) weekly. Her net income is usually spent on purchasing additional animals to raise and sell again. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to use a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to purchase beverages, coffee, sugar, candies, breads, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, coffee, sugar, candies, breads, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Faraja Mavurunza Group

texts.en:
Faraja Mavurunza is a member of the existing entrepreneurial group from Tujijenge Tanzania formed by three woman and one man. The group has now formed 13 loan cycles since the beginning with hardworking civilians who join themselves as a way to rescue hard-life conditions. 

Monica is a new member in this group.  She is in her forties and has two school-going children. She is not married, so with a great effort, she has been supporting her family by running a small food business (mamalishe). She has been serving breakfast, lunch and sometime supper for ten good years now. She works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This is Monica's first loan cycle from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to replenish her food business with rice, cooking oil, maize and baking flour, sugar, and salt. Her desire is to greatly expand her business portfolio with a shop selling drinks. She believes by doing so, her monthly income will grow and she can live a better life with her children. Her group is thankful for every lender who make this loan possible. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a multi-functional printer and stock for her business.

loans.name: Chiv's Group

texts.en:
Chiv is 61 years old and a father of four, one of whom is in school. His entire family strives for a living through a pig-raising business and rice farming. 

To supplement his income, he works for others for a fee. This business earns him about 20,800 KHR (Cambodian Riel) per day to cover the needs of his family. This is the original loan for Chiv with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, he has formed a group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his crop and pig’s feed for his pig-raising business. He hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single woman. She is a beautician who owns her own salon which has a number of clients from around her neighborhood.  Alaa holds a university degree and a technical degree in beauty, hairdressing and make-up with over six years of experience as a beautician. 
She believes that more growth can be made in her business, so she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her current inventory of beauty products, hair colors, accessories and hair dryers. In the future, Alaa intends to open a larger salon, allowing her to hire a couple of employees who will support her in her business development and she might open a beauty technical school in her community.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory of beauty products, hair colors, accessories and hair dryers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
This is Valentina. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase thread, needles and clothing materials for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles and clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa es lo que ha llevado a salir adelante a Luz Marina; una mujer amable, humilde y trabajadora. Ella tiene 27 años, está en unión libre y tiene un hijo. Hace cinco años estableció su puesto en una de las calles más transitadas de su comunidad,  lugar donde ofrece ropa para niños y adultos. Su compañero de vida ha sido su principal soporte, ambos luchan por brindarle a su familia un futuro prospero y lleno de oportunidades.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar ropa, tanto de niños como adultos, desde calcetines hasta ropa interior. Luz Marina ha logrado aumentar su clientela y al mismo tiempo sus ganancias. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir creciendo, razón por la que día a día se esfuerza en brindar  atención y productos de calidad.
texts.en:
A small clothing stall is what has allowed Luz Marina to get by; a polite, humble and hard-working woman, she is 27 years old. She is and in an open relationship and has a son.

Five years ago she set up the stall in one of the streets with the most foot traffic in her community, a place where she offered clothing for adults and for children. Her life partner has been her primary supporter; both of them fight to bring her family a bright future full of opportunities.

She requests a loan to increase the sales in her business. She wants to buy clothing, whether for children or adults, ranging from socks to underwear. Luz Marina has been able to increase her clientele and at the same time her earnings. One of her goals is to continue growing, for which she strives daily to provide customer service and quality items.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children as well as for adults, from socks to underwear.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon and her family are residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are in school. She struggles to make a living and to cover school expenses through one hectare of rice farming which she has occupied for about seven years already. The agribusiness has returned an average of 38,300 KHR per day. Mon is the leader of a group of two members. This is the third cycle for her and the first time for her partner to request for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The group has applied for a loan of 1,3000,000 KHR, of which Mon owns a portion of 700,000 KHR. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees on the farm in hope of earning a higher yield. Mon believes that the loan will allow her to gradually uplift her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 39-year-old lady and single mother of two children; all are in school. She is a repeat borrower at UGAFODE microfinance ltd. (MDI) who last took a loan of 3,000,000 ugx that helped her increase the working capital of her mobile money business. She is a resident of the city outskirts. She has been operating a mobile money business since 2010 that she started with a minimum working capital of 1, 000,000 ugx and has gradually increased it, though not yet enough to meet her client's needs. She is applying for a loan of 5,000,000 ugx to boost her business by opening another branch in the busy city center. She believes this will help her to increase her income and be able to stabilize her finances. However, she faces the challenge of high taxes from the city council authority in addition to too many fraudulent acts and increased ground rent. She is very appreciative of the financial support from UGAFODE microfinance ltd. and the partnership with the Kiva lenders which she looks towards maintaining. She is resilient.

loans.use: to open a mobile money float.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en: A resident of Thmor Korl district of Battambang province, Sitha is a 58-year-old farmer and also a mother of 5 children. Currently, 4 of her children are living dependent on her. She has struggled to earn a living through rice farming for about 20 years. Sitha is the leader of a group of two members. This is the 4th and the 3rd cycle for her and her partner, respectively, to seek a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group, they request a loan of 2,500,000 KHR which Sitha owns a share of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing of her rice farm. She hopes that the loan enables her to uplift the situation of her family progressively.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing

loans.name: Ivis Viviana

texts.es:
Actualmente, Ivis, de 32 años, se encuentra dedicada a la cría y venta de pollos de engorde. Estos pollos los cuida y engorda en un galpón construido a un lado de su casa.
Es una actividad aprendida de forma empírica, aprovechando su vida en el campo y con el afán de obtener recursos para su hijo, decidió iniciar con este negocio.
Hoy en día es una mujer muy trabajadora, con metas claras, corazón noble y mirada siempre en sus objetivos, ella desea poder comprar una casa propia para vivir allí con su hijo ya que es madre soltera.
Siempre ha tenido el valor de enfrentar los problemas y adversidades sin importar lo duro de las condiciones.
Ella pide un aliento económico para la compra de gallinas ponedoras, que le darán un impulso a su negocio y harán que su producción crezca.
Con el préstamo ella podrá darse el lujo de tener una mayor cantidad de pollos y huevos para vender aumentando así su ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ivis, 32 years old, is currently working breeding and selling broiler chickens. She takes care of these chickens and fattens them in a shed built on the side of her house. It is an empirically learned activity, taking advantage of her life in the countryside and in an effort to obtain resources for her child. 

She wishes to buy her own house to live there with her son because she is a single mother. She has always had the courage to confront problems and adversity no matter how tough the conditions. 

She is asking for economic help to purchase laying hens that will give some momentum to her business and make the production grow. With the loan she will be able to give herself the luxury to have a greater number of chickens and eggs to sell, increasing her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase laying hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, liquid plant food, among others to nurse her coffee plants.

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Joseline, who is in her early 60s, is married with six grown-up children. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for three years now.  She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Joseline's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the genge (fruit and vegetable) stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more items for her fruit and vegetable business. She dreams of owning a food retail shop.

Joseline will share this loan with her loan group "ORANGE" which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more items for her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en:
Moung Russey district of Battambang province is where Veoun and her family are living. She is a 51-year-old farmer and also a mother of 6 children; 2 of them are living dependent on her as they are in school. She struggles to earn a living and to pay for school expenses of her two children who are currently in school through the 5 hectares area of rice farming. This business has been the main source of income for her family for 15 years. 

This is the 6th cycle for Veoun and her partner as a borrower of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They have successfully repaid the past loan and it has allowed them to gradually improve their living condition. Now, as the leader of the group of two members, Veoun requests a loan of 500,000 KHR, of which she owns a portion of 200,000 KHR. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the rice farm. She hopes that she will get a higher yield from the farm through the support of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en: Samon is a resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children. She struggles to make a living by farming on a two-hectare plot where she grows rice. She has been farming for thirty years, which is almost her entire life. Samon and her business partner have taken out and repaid one previous loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are now applying for a second loan for 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Samon will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a fee to plow her land. She believes that her family's living conditions will improve thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en: Sherwin is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is engaged in buying and selling footware in the public market to generate income. He aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to sustain the necessities of  life for his family. Having insufficient capital, Sherwin would like to avail of a loan for PHP30,000 to buy more stocks of slippers, sandals and flower pots to resell.  He believes having this financial assistance will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 34-year-old mother of three whose husband works in fixing cars' body work for their living. Rola opened a grocery store just a few months ago in order to cover some of the increasing expenses of her family. The grocery store has many loyal customers who enjoy Rola's quality products and her affordable prices. 

Rola tries to take advantage of every opportunity in life, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her inventory at her shop, especially with special summer beverages and with special Holy Ramadan month's dates. She hopes to continue growing her business so that it can be a more stable source of income in the years to come.

loans.use: To increase her inventory at her shop.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 45 years of age, married to a carpenter, and blessed with two children. 

She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost seven years and is earning a net income of 500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) daily. Her income on this business is usually spent on purchasing kitchen wares to use. 

Due to insufficient funds to run her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, milk, and breads to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, milk, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.   

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Maribeth has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past six months, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mom is 45 years old and a married mother blessed with eight children. Nowadays, she needs to support six dependent children, as three are still little and three are in school. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice on four and half hectares of farmland as her main business, and also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is the business that she has had for 24 years.  

This is the fourth micro loan for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loans completely and they have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, Mom leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fee, and to buy insecticide. She hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay for plowing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia works hard to support her family. Patricia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase household good to sell like soap, spices, coffee, etc.

Patricia has been in this business for 2 years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Fedilyn

texts.en:
Fedilyn works hard to support her family. She  is married and has six children who are in school.  

Fedilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines.   She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.  

Fedilyn has been in this business for 8 years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing nets
